Not only did Amazon have the best price to begin with, shipping was free without tax. FIVE STARS to both

Reviews.Title: Awesome Flat screen and wall mount.
Reviews.Author: Steve Clark "Steve"
Reviews.Content: There is nothing positive I can add that has not beeen posted already. I did a lot of research and this tv by far meets all my expectations. The Touch of Red makes this the classiest looking flat screen I have ever seen. Delivery could not have been any quicker or uneventful. I purchased the Peerless ST650P Tilting Wall Mount which was a piece of cake to mount.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amber Conover
Reviews.Content: I'm not a TV techie but I love my Samsung.  My ex-roomate tried to out-do me and bought a 46' Sony Bravia 120 ghz, samething basically.  My Samsung looks soooo much better.  Especially the touch of red in the frame makes the TV look good just sitting there doing nothing,heh.  Works great with my PS3, HD cable DVR, and hooking up my laptop to it is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Incredible TV, incredible value from Amazon
Reviews.Author: G. Hodgkins
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be more pleased with this television.  The contrast that this set offers both with its 50000:1 ratio and its screen technology is phenomenal (the 530 and lesser models do not provide the same "pop" because they lack 1 or both of these two factors).  Seen side by side in the stores there is no comparison in the blackness of the blacks this set delivers(at least in its/my price range).This brings me to my second point - value.  Purchased from Amazon (just before Thanksgiving)for $1500/no tax/free shipping/24 months interest free, this set is cheaper than the lesser but ever popular and well rated 550 model in stores and only $200 more than it online.  The $200 is well worth the increased contrast obtained from the 650, in my opinion.  No problems with the free CEVA shipping offered by Amazon.  They even allowed me to pick up the set at their local distribution office (ok, I was excited to get it).In addition, if that weren't a great enough value - I got a Samsung 1500 Blue Ray player for $198 with $200 instant rebate on Amazon when I purchased them together.  I've been smiling everytime I see these players for $199 in "Doorbuster" Christmas sales.  Incidentally, if you are new to the HD game like I was, please note that the difference in the quality of picture you achieve from HD programing vs. Blu-ray if astounding.  Do yourself a favor and invest in a Blu-ray player.  As one reviewer I came across in my research said, the picture on the 650 (especially using blu-ray) looks like you're looking out a window.  It's that good.My only other suggestion is to invest in (at least a cheap) Harmony remote, like the 550 ($50 on sale).  You will not regret the incredible ease of use and simplicity it provides by allowing you to switch back and forth between dvd and tv watching without scrolling through menus to change the input, which can become cumbersome.

Reviews.Title: White Glove Delivery Not What I Expected...
Reviews.Author: Mark Krom "Mork"
Reviews.Content: First, let me say this is a beautiful TV.  I love the picture and have had no problems setting it up or watching all varieties of input, from old VHS to 1080p HD signals.However, when I received the TV through the white glove delivery service, the installers were unable to do anything but place the TV on the stand.  The reason is that the TV had been in a cold delivery truck all day, and I risked damage to the TV if I plugged it in and turned it on before it hit room temperature.  I thus could not verify the picture was OK and that there were no missing pixels, which was unfortunate because I intended to do this and then have them take the packing materials (another feature of the delivery service).  I ended up taking the gamble and sending the materials back with them anyway, and I haven't had any problems with the TV.  However, just a warning that if you expect to be able to set up the TV and see a picture before the delivery men leave, you may be disappointed if it's winter.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV and Service
Reviews.Author: indiefilm "filmguy"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this from Amazon and am astounded by how amazing this tv is and the service Amazon provided.  I've ordered many things from Amazon in the past without issue, but was still a little wary of ordering such a big ticket item online.  I can say that I'm glad I did.  Not only did I get by far the lowest price available anywhere, they provided free white glove delivery.The quality of this tv is well beyond my expectations.  Crystal clear hi def makes you feel like you're really there.  The sound quality is wonderful as well.  There have been some comments about the sound quality, but I find the sound is so good that I don't even use my external speakers when watching it.As I said, the price is amazing.  For $1500 with no tax and free white glove delivery, it cannot be beat.  They unboxed the tv, set it up in my living room and even took my old tv away so I didn't have to bother getting rid of it myself (it was a 32" Sony Trinitron).  That's what I call amazing service.I checked prices of every major retailer over several weeks and did a comparison of all the tvs I was considering at my local retailers several times as well, and nothing came close to the quality of the Samsung 650 tv.If you're considering this tv, I would look no further.  Very very happy with my purchase from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Unbeatable
Reviews.Author: havochappy
Reviews.Content: I'll not go into alot of technical info on this unit since there is already plenty out there. This Summer I decided to take the plunge into high-def. After extensive research, viewing different tv's at the box stores, and consulting my high-tech guru friend, I decided on the Samsung LN46A650. When I found that Amazon sold it for hundreds less than the local box stores, I decided to give them a try. From beginning to end and everything in between, I am completely happy. For my purposes the tv is superb. The picture(which is almost my only concern) is gorgeous in HD. I would rate the std. picture as just above average, though that really shouldn't be relevant because if you're going to spend this kind of money on a HIGH-DEFINITON tv, you probably want to watch HD signals and sources. There were no problems through the delivery process, which was faster than expected. All in all, for the money this unit can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: David Hynes
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research into finding a LCD HDTV television. I first thought I'd want  Sony because my daughter had purchased a 46" LCD HDTV Sony television. However, my son-in-law had purchased a Samsung and was very pleased with it. I checked with Consumter Reports and it rated the Samsung higher than the Sony. Now that I had decided on a Samsung, I wanted to find the best price. I checked the Big Box National electronic stores (Best Buy, Circuit City), Sams Club, and my local Ultimate Electronics store but felt I could find a better deal online. Checking online, I found some really seductive low prices but they were from online stores I had never heard of. In the end , I felt the price I got at Amazon was really low for a name internet store plus there was no sales tax and no shipping charge. The TV arrived within a few days even though the estimated delivery time was a week. The delivery truck driver even said that I had a full 30 days to return the TCV to Amazon for any reason (which I did not know when I bought it) so that was an added plus. The TV is performing very well. I highly recommend the Samsung TV and purchasing it through Amazon!Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with RED Touch of Color

Reviews.Title: Awsome picture
Reviews.Author: Richard Luery "Rickster"
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with RED Touch of ColorI searched for a 46" lcd tv for about 2 years and this was absolutely the best purchase I could have made. The price was about $500 less than buying at Circuit City and Best Buy and no tax. The picture is fantastic and the tv was delivered before the estimated time of arrival.

Reviews.Title: Finally bit the bullet.. and no regrets!
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Pondevida
Reviews.Content: I'm so happy my search is over.  I can finally relax and enjoy this amazing product.  After months of researching and reading so many reviews of this product, I finally bit the bullet and decided on Samsung's LN46A650 Flat Panel LCD HDTV.  I've had this TV for almost 2 months now.  I was expecting to run into that power issue I've been reading about, but I guess I'm one of the fortunate ones.  It has been solid out of the box w/ no issues whatsoever!  I've been looking forward to turning this TV on everyday when I come home from work.  It's just such a beautiful TV.  Picture quality is amazing.  HD channels look sweet.  DVD movies look spectacular.  The sound is great coming from the TV (there's even an equalizer to adjust the sound quality), but will be hooking up a Home Theater System anyways... you just have too! It would be a shame not too.  I have no issues with the remote.  I get many compliments from friends who come over.  They are just amazed w/ the picture quality.I have 2 other roomates that have their own LCD TV's around the 40" size w/ 1080p and I must say... they don't even come close to the picture quality this TV produces.  For those of you who are still thinking about getting this particular model... trust me and trust all the countless positive reviews you read online... you will have no regrets!  You will love it.  You will have a wonderful experience spending all that hard earned cash! Well worth the investment!  Amazon has one of the best prices and their shipping service for this product was spot on!  So go ahead and click on 'Add to cart'!

Reviews.Title: Yes the Samsung LN46A650 is that good and that easy
Reviews.Author: J. Myers
Reviews.Content: This was too easy.  Price?  Silly low compared to box stores and electronics retailer ($1500).  Delivery was simple and the guys were great.  Picture quality is fantastic, the difference between the 5 series and the 6 series is noticeable.  The 5 series was wonderful - the 6 is spectacular.  For some, the 120Hz Auto Motion Plus setting of "high" will be too vivid and real looking ... like a soap opera.  You can tone this down by using the "low" setting or even turn it off.  And for those of you concerned about the red hue on the frame of the TV - don't worry, it's not that noticeable.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds Expectations! Amazing Clarity & Picture! Great Options! Speedy Delivery!
Reviews.Author: B. Hayton "B. Hayton"
Reviews.Content: Let me start off my saying that this TV is amazing! I was first contemplating on getting the 5 series (Ln52a550) larger screen @ 52" at little bit more in price but lower in specs (i.e. lower contrast ratio and no 120hz). But I decided to go with a 46" in more picture quality than the 52". I am very pleased with my decision! Before I purchased the TV on Amazon, I went to my local Best Buy to look at the picture qualities and compare the various models. Right away, I can notice the deeper blacks and the more vibrant colors produced from this 6 series HDTV. The "ultra clear panel" glossy coat on the screen (similarly to what you see in plasmas) attribute to the more vibrant colors and deeper blacks, which in my opinion really deliver on a great picture. Please note, this might not be ideal for those who can't control the ambient lighting in the room because you might see a little glare. However, this is not a problem for me.One of my biggest dilemmas was this whole thing on the "120hz" auto motion, do I spend less and not worry about this feature or pay a little extra to have the latest technology out there in terms of LCD's? Well since I'm a gamer and I like watching sports, I opted to go withthe 120hz. At first, right out the box, the TV's settings have the 120hz on medium. The motion looked really awkward to me, sinceI'm not used to the 120hz motion flow (my previous TV being a 720p 32" LCD mind you). The great thing I noticed when going through the picture options is that you can customize the settings to be off, low, medium, high, etc. So in other words, you can ease yourself in to the 120hz motion by starting off on low and turn it up when you feel you're ready for it. In my opinion, it looks great on the low setting.Other great features include: electrostatic touch sensitive controls on the TV bezel (adds to the sleek design), many picture adjustment options, ease of navigating menus, really nice remote with backlighting, great sound produced by the built-in down-firing speakers, ultra fast response time for gaming, info link to display RSS feeds such as weather and news (just connect it with a ethernet cable to your router / wireless option available), and swivel stand (for those of you that are not wall mounting this bad boy).One last thing that is important to note, Amazon's delivery service exceeded my expectations! When I purchased the TV I was quoted by the automated system on receiving the item in like 7 business days. I may have been lucky or Amazon is just good like this, but I actually got the TV in 3 business days!!! The delivery service called me the day before it was delivered to confirm a time to deliver the TV. Once the delivery got to my house, they called me to let me know they were here! The box was brought up to my house in a perfect condition box. If you're like me, even so the product may be good inside, but I hate boxes that look like they were beat up in transit. All in all, GREAT SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV . . . Sharp, Detailed Picture . . . Easy to Mount
Reviews.Author: Aceswoosh
Reviews.Content: I replaced a 56-inch Toshiba DLP rear projection set with this 46-inch LCD model from Samsung. At first, I was a little hesitant to drop my screen size 10 inches, and was even MORE hesitant about mounting such a large TV on my living room wall.After a few weeks of research including trips to various electronics stores, reading reviews on CNET, Consumer Reports, and others, I learned that Samsung is moving to the forefront of the LCD industry, and I can definitely see why. After purchasing the TV and getting it up on the wall, I can't believe I didn't do this sooner.The picture on the 650 model is amazing, even compared to my old DLP set (which had a pretty fantastic picture in its own right). To me, the most important facet of a TV's picture is the sharpness of an image (i.e. how rich and true its black levels are, and how crisp and defined images look). In this price range, I haven't seen another TV that even comes close to the image quality on the 650. High-definition programs in 1080i look amazing. Blu-ray movies and Playstation 3 games in 1080p will absolutely blow your mind.The 120Hz processing feature makes sports come to life. The "blurred ball" effect is virtually removed, and every replay seems to come to life because it's so smooth. In fact, the 120 Hz processing is SO effective, that I have to turn it off during movies and TV shows, because it makes the picture look TOO realistic, and can make pre-recorded film look like live live-action TV video.As far as mounting the TV, getting it connected and all that other stuff . . . . . piece of cake. Plenty of outputs (even I can't fill 4 HDMI). For true videophiles, there are a number of different options to fine-tune the picture quality. On-screen menus and the remote are a breeze to navigate.I was a little worried about the red accents along the outer edge of the TV, but in all honesty, you don't even notice them unless the TV is getting direct sunlight. At night, or with the blinds closed, you can barely even tell the red accent is there.I can't recommend this TV enough. If you're looking to make that next jump into HDTV, don't look anywhere else but Samsung and Sony. And, as far as value goes, the best bang for the buck is right here with Samsung's 650 series.

Reviews.Title: Short Life of TV
Reviews.Author: Sandy "bay area"
Reviews.Content: I was really happy to buy this TV and didn't have any issues for 18 months but the TV suddenly started switching on / off. I called Samsung service center and problem seemed to be well known capacitor issue. The customer service opened a ticket and asked me to wait for technician. The technician came and opened the TV and found the power supply is bad which will cost me $500 to repair.TV will probably last for less then 2 years.

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: mvg "movie junkie"
Reviews.Content: Buy this TV. The picture quality on Directv HD is amazing. I just wish DTVwould put more channels people actually watch in HD. There is one issuethough  *******If you have the directv DVR******** The remote control with the dvr will stop working if you have the energy save mode ON.I had 2 techs from DTV and they could not figure it out. I called Samsungand they told me just turn energy save off. If you lower the backlight to below 3 it can trigger energy save and there goes the remote. a simple fix if you know. Otherwise perfect picture on HDTV and underrated sound quality. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: FABULOUS!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jana B. Payton "Redhead64"
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous TV.  I spent over a year trying to decide which one to buy, and used the reviews of Amazon customers to make my decision. This TV is everything it is touted to be. It has a great picture, easy set-up, and I don't have any problems with the remote. The slight touch of red on the bezel actually compliments the sofa, but if you have something different, I don't think it would make a difference.  There are plenty of inputs for DVD, game stations, etc., and they are easy to reach. I only have 2 things to comment on regarding this purchase.  One is minor, but the 2nd is a great warning to others.The minor one.  I purchased a smaller Samsung earlier with the free "White Glove Delivery".  I received it a little late in the afternoon, but the delivery person was kind, and set it up, programmed it to make sure it would work properly, gave instructions, and removed the box.  This time, the person removed the TV from the box, and assisted boyfriend to put it up and plug it in.  However, he gave no assistance for programming, and told us we needed to keep the box for 30 days.  It is not a big deal, and since I didn't pay extra for delivery, I can't really complain.  They did deliver ahead of schedule, but if you have used this service before, it is dependent on the delivery person.  My 2nd thing is the most important thing for anyone who is purchasing a LCD TV and planning on changing from the stand to a mount.  Because of the configuration, we needed to remove the stand and attach the TV to an articulating wall mount.  (There is a fabulous one available on Amazon for only $154.90 - much less than everyone else)  After completing the construction needed, everything went well, until the mount needed to be attached to the TV.  MAKE SURE, WHEN YOU ATTACH A MOUNT TO THE TV, YOU LAY IT ON A SOFT SURFACE.  Boyfriend laid it on a clean glass coffee table, but it put a small (and I mean really small) nick in the screen, which has ruined the TV.  It is frustrating, of course not covered by warranty, and when we talked to the local repair people, they told us that we were looking at $1400.00 to fix it.  Simply not worth it.So, if you are looking for a fabulous 46" LCD TV, I totally recommend this product.  I have grown to love Samsung products, and this one won't disappoint you.  Just don't make the same mistake I did, and have to buy it again.  Take care if you decide to change it from the stand to a mount - the screen is everything.  But you will not be sorry with this purchase, and, luckily, it is even cheaper right now to buy it from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: No Regrets
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Beaudoin "Mike B"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a pro regarding televisions and certainly don't pretend to be. However, before buying this TV I did a lot of research (almost too much). This TV is amazing. The DVD upscaling from my ps3 blows my mind alone, then there's blue ray... amazing. I'll list a few pros/cons so I don't ramble on for too long:PROs1)blue ray and up scaled dvd's are vibrant.2)gta iv and other ps3 games whether 1080 or 720 are beautiful and smooth3)lots of inputs. 4 HDMI! Also, convenient connectors on side for quick setup.4)turned off, the TV makes the room look sweet. The red isn't overwhelming in the least.5)lots of options in menu. good for a variety of viewing options/environments6)120 HZ is adjustable, necessary cause well... go to a store and see.7)Although pricey, it's cheaper than comparable TVsCONS1)The remote is terrible. It's as if an ipod had a slow cousin. Minor pain.2)Although I don't have issues with glare, it is possible to see how a house with lots of windows could be problematic.3)It can be hard to watch basic broadcasting cable (no HD Box... yet) but what HDTV would look amazing without a digital box?4)speakers aren't great (plan to get sound system)5)120 HZ sometimes can be too good. Change is difficult for some people.6)I can't stop watching movies/playing games; so pretty.No issues so far, but I haven't had it more than a month yet. Also, the TV was purchased at a store and not online, though it is cheaper on Amazon.My advice is to check it out at a store first. It is prefect for me but of course people have different opinions. Usually after I make a big purchase there's a moment of regret or guilt. With this TV, I still feel I made a quality investment and increased my quality of life. There are a lot of variables to buying a TV today so do your research. I would recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: T. T. Wong "deosola"
Reviews.Content: I've owned this TV for over 10 weeks now.  After spending much time at the big box stores looking at various TVs and doing research on what others said, I can now say after 10 weeks of ownership that this is the best TV on the market at it's price range.The picture quality can't be beat.  It has both a sharp picture and accurate colors.  The blacks are the deepest in this price range.  It is easy to use and easy to look at.The only negatives are as follows:1)  The remote's wheel feature is difficult to use.2)  The reflection on the screen is significant.3)  My first TV had a dead pixel (but I returned it and the 2nd one is perfect)I would highly recommend this TV to anyone looking for a LCD w/120HZ feature.

Reviews.Title: Amazing stunning picture
Reviews.Author: S. Elgan
Reviews.Content: This is the best LCD TV I have ever seen.  It really is that good.  The black levels are great and the colors and clarity on HD material is stunning.  It even does an amazing job on upscaled DVD from my PS3, colors are especially good.  I also own another 37" LCD which is very good especailly for computer use, but this thing runs circles around it in the picture quality arena, less particles, almost no digital artifacting, awesome contrast, vibrant colors etc.  You really have to see it to understand.  It is also the best LCD screen I have seen for component material.  I've always been dissappointed with LCDs in the past due to crushed blacks and muted colors via component, but this TV does a jaw dropping good job with component as well as HDMI. I've never seen my wii picture look so good.The 120hz refresh actually does help.  I did quite a few tests with it and it does help keep the screen smoother without any noticable sacrifice in quality.  The connection to the internet is handy if you are into news feeds, stocks, and weather.For those that have this TV, I found that putting it on movie mode and taking the back light down to 4 really helped make the picture even better from the default settings...allows the contrast improve markedly.  I found the picture at default is a bit cold and the contrast is too extreme due to over brightness leaving out quite a bit of detail in darker sceens and crushing the blacks.The only issue I have with it is that it sometimes has a scrambled image when I turn it on.  I'm pretty sure this is a freak, isolated issue with just my screen or a handful as I've never seen anything like it.  You can still see the picture, but the colors are all out of whack and there is horizontal banding throughout the image.I called up Samsung and they were great with their customer service and got me a service ticket immediately with a local fix it shop.  They came out the next day and took the TV, but they couldn't get it to replicate the issue in the 5 days they played with it--figures.  So they brought it back and of course it worked again just fine for about 5 days and then yesterday it started doing it again.  It isn't a permanent issue because I just turn it off and then when I turn it back on it takes about 10 seconds and then the picture pops back in with no problem, but the issue is annoying.  This time I'm taking video of the issue to show the technicians for my next trouble call.

Reviews.Title: Superb TV. Best quality picture!
Reviews.Author: N. Morris
Reviews.Content: I have to give this TV a 5 star rating. I can't even tell you how happy I am with this purchase.Three areas where I wouldn't give it a 5:- The remote control "iPod" style rotating select tool really is hard to use. However, since I use my receiver's remote (it's fully programmable) I don't need to use the TV remote. I use TiVo to change channels so I really don't use my TV remote much at all.- When viewing the TV from an angle, the black contrast ratio decreases (ie, the black isn't the pure solid black that you get while looking at the TV straight-on).- The 120Hz effect is excellent when set on Low, but when it's on High (or even Medium some times) it creates a sort of "haze/optical distortion" around images that are moving over a non-moving background.Excellent TV, super clear image, love the vivid colours, the contrast ratio is superb.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic - you get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Sean Flanagan "Sean Flanagan"
Reviews.Content: As with most electronics you get what you pay for.  I did a lot a research for a good sized HDTV and the review consensus is that this new line of Samsung TV's have a better picture than the Sony's.  I would have to agree (of course because I own a Samsung now).  I have a PS3 hooked up for blu-ray and DirecTV for hidef satellite.  Yes the picture can appear 'grainy' depending on the source and the quality of the original HD picture but with the correct settings you can hardly notice.  Blu-ray planet earth even has a few spots where the picture quality wasn't as great as the other 96% of the show and if you nit pick you can see some pixelation.  The AMP 120hz setting, I found, really does help when a mountain peak is moving across the screen.  Use the 'demo' mode to see the difference when a large stationary object is moving across the screen.You need to calibrate the picture for the source you're using to get the 'great' picture.  There's a 1260+ post thread on the AVS forums dedicated to calibrating this set with different sources and firmware versions so I highly recommend spending some time there to learn more and get the picture set correctly.The order process via Amazon went great and I ended up getting it shipped from 6ave via Amazon.  6ave has refunded my card twice match Amazon's price drops so kudos to that company as well as Amazon and Samsung.The Sony universal remote has a code that perfectly matches this TV if you have gripes about the wheel on the remote.  This new Samsung series is most definitely the sweet spot for price/quality and the ln46a650 takes top honors in my (biased) book.

Reviews.Title: A Step Above
Reviews.Author: Colin M. Mcconville "CMcCon342"
Reviews.Content: The TV is amazing. I looks like you're peaking through a window. It's more than the resolution (which is perfect), it is the depth of color and the motion. It is so real it takes a little time to get used to (and you can remove the effect if it bothers you), but it will blow friends and family away (which is always nice).The sound is fine (if you get the 750 series it has a built-in woofer), the remote isn't perfect, but its no where near as bad as some of the reviews would lead you to believe.It also handles standard definition TV very well (some LCDs don't look so hot). Its probably the best TV on the market as of right now, and it isn't overly expensive, if you are struggling to decide, just click BUY NOW, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Life-like Picture
Reviews.Author: Boston Tee
Reviews.Content: Initial purchase was on Amazon through another seller, which didn't come through... a bit frustrating, but once I ordered directly from Amazon, everything was great. Have had the TV for a few weeks now - just added HD and DVR with my existing DirecTV subscription, and the picture is really life-like. The detail is stunning - especially sports. Watching the NBA games, the detail on the player tattoos, even. Can't wait for football season!I will say that changing channels seems to take a little bit longer than before, but other than that, no complaints (and that's a small one). I'd read on Amazon that the TV sound wasn't the best, but it sounds fine, even at low volume.TV set up was easy, and the delivery was well ahead of schedule. With the 30-day price guarantee, I've shaved close to another $200 off of the price I originally paid for it, and Amazon (all via e-mail) has been very responsive in providing the discounts (subsequent pricing on Amazon compared to what I initially paid).You won't go wrong with this TV, in my opinion, and Amazon's customer service is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Great tv....read review for a couple of complaints....
Reviews.Author: Jacob Lambert "jlambert1982"
Reviews.Content: First off, this is an incredible television.  I have never seen such picture clarity.  Plenty of inputs, I actually like the touch of red color, basically I have NEVER seen a better looking television.Now, for my complaints.... (please note these are not about the tv, more my set up and situation)1:  With the wall mount I bought, Sanus Systems VMAA26B Universal Articulating Mount with Extended Reach, it covers my component inputs.  This really sucks for my Wii, but I can just swap back to the AV cable.  I didn't knock off anything for this item, but I will on my mount review.  Don't say it's compatible if you're going to lose functionality.Well I guess that wasn't "complaints" really.  And again, this is a GREAT  television.  I would tell anyone looking to consider it.Update 2011Tv had worked great until around May 2011.  Then it started the dreaded "clicking" problem and wouldn't immediately power on.  Around August it wouldn't stay powered on after the clicking spells.  I went on Samsungs website for support, and it was out of warranty, no luck.  Read some reviews and saw this is a VERY common problem and that many folks were having their sets repaired free of charge by Samsung.  Well I decided to go to the online chat for support on their website, let them know that it was the same symptoms as the 1000s of capacitor complaints I've read online, but again I was told that my warranty was expired and I was out of luck.  I was very frustrated with the lack of support, but didn't give up.  10 minutes after the online chat runaround, I called their customer support and fibbed.  I told them I had a repairman look at my TV and he said it was a capacitor problem.  He said before before he charged me I should call Samsung b/c they were covering the repair charge.  The customer service rep confirmed that if my tv was within a range of models, they would do a one time replacement of the capacitors for free.  Sure enough, this model qualified, and in 2 weeks a service tech showed up at my door and was in and out in less than an hour.  Now my tv is working like new.  Frustrating that even though my product was registered and this is a VERY VERY common issue that I didn't get an email or something giving me steps.  Even more frustrating that online chat rep didn't help more, but I can't complain about free repair work.

Reviews.Title: Samsung won me over while I was saving for a Sony
Reviews.Author: Wayne K. Williams "Randomaxe"
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, before my purchase of the A650. I was price comparing for a Sony 46 inch XBR5 and thought that was the gold standard. One day, while shopping in Sears for clothes for my kids which always requires a detour to electronics just to comfirm my previous judgement of Sony's superiority in LCD televisions. As it happens, at this Sears they have a Samsung 71 series right next to XBR5 and I still thought the XBR was slightly better at color accuracy. My 2 Daughters 9 and 11 always picked the Sony as looking more realistic to them. After confirming what we already concluded. We walked to the end of the isle to look at LCD stands. That was the first time I saw the A650 and the first thing I thought was this is a Plasma. The glossy panel and deep black levels were striking and the color detail in this set edged past the XBR5. So my children now told me the A650 was now the best set in the store.By this time a sale person had come over and started her pitch and I probibly would have made a bad impulse purchase, except I didn't want to make payments on a TV. So I went home and found the A650 at Amazom $900.00 cheaper and $700.00 cheaper than the lowest XBR5 price from a reputable seller.I've have this set for 5 weeks now. Its connected to dish network through HDMI cables and 20 year old pioneer av receiver with HD dvd player. This lcd was a snap to set up, I think it took me 15 minutes. The HD dvd is the pinnacle of picture reproduction and this set blows my old Vizio away. I Am legend, Stardust, and Serenity looked awesome. When a broadcast is HD content, this set gets it almost as good as my HD dvd. When they are upconverting content to you, you can see the quality is not up to snuff. You can't blame the tv for that. You buy this TV and you will smile every time you turn it on.P.S. don't let the red border affect your consideration all of my equipment is black and that's what the border looks like most of the time. It only looks red when I have all my lights turned on and its never distracting.

Reviews.Title: A great TV!
Reviews.Author: Malhanon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in May, 2008.  It took Amazon's shipping service less than a week to get it to me.  The delivery people were friendly, professional, and quick.  Maybe a little to anxious to leave, but they stayed until I told them I was satisfied.  They came at 11am, when the rep told me they would be there between 10am and noon.  That's pretty prompt!The TVWhat can I say.  The picture is fantastic, the numerous picture options/controls allow a high level of control.  Maybe too much!  The sound is even good for stereo speakers on a TV.  Overall, after spending 18 months looking for the right TV and reading volumes of reviews, this TV takes the cake and gets a gold star.  The biggest drawback, the remote.  While everything you need is there, the wheel that you use to control the menu options - which is stylized after the iPod - does not work very well.  You either turn it too slow, and the option does not change, or too fast and you skip past the option you want.  I read the consumer reviews about this and was forewarned.  But, in the end it does not matter, I am using the Logitech 880 Universal Remote.The ToCThis has to be the dumbest marketing thing I have seen in a while.  The color is not that noticeable so if you, like me, do not like it, it is easy to ignore.  If they wanted something to accent the rooms décor, why not allow you to change the color???  Anyway, don't base your decision on the ToC feature either way.The Glossy ScreenI can see why some people do not like the glossy screen.  I personally think that the matte screens are blurry and the colors washed out.  All of the TVs I have looked at had the glossy screen.  I guess this is just a personal choice.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my purchase
Reviews.Author: Sparkymon
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about a month now, and I really like it.  The picture is great, and Amazon had the best price I've found for this unit.  What can I say?  No problems so far.

Reviews.Title: Zero buyers remorse; a safe bet
Reviews.Author: DB9
Reviews.Content: Picture Quality is excellent on this set. The standard picture setting preset is near flawless when compared to calibration patterns and even standard def TV becomes tolerable when watching in the wide-fit picture mode.When using HDMI be sure to adjust the HDMI black level setting to avoid overly dark images but otherwise near perfect. The just-scan picture mode is great for high def sources like bluray, gaming or even HD broadcast; be sure to use game mode for gaming as this set introduces a lot of lag otherwise.The 120 frame auto-motion is fairly useless however and the TV looks its best when this feature is turned off. The one time it may have been useful, gaming, becomes a moot point since you can't have the auto motion on while in game mode. Bluray 1080p/24fps is awesome though and the 120 frames per second makes this possible so it is still worth it to have.The only real complaint I have is that the plastic bezel, the touch of color border around the edge of the screen, came with some factory defects in it; a noticeable dimple near the buttons and many many scratches that are clearly visible in some lighting situations. In direct sunlight the bezel also shows its transparency which can be distracting and make the TV look like a cheap plastic set.Overall though I don't have any regret in buying this set as it oozes quality from almost every aspect; little things like the blue filter and auto disabling of inputs that aren't powered on to make switching sources easier really give the impression that time was taken when designing the set. I just wish I could make it ignore the standard analog coax input because I will never, EVER use that. Period. This isn't a complaint against this TV though as EVERY HD TV I've used does this for some reason.Until new technology becomes mainstream, maybe OLED TVs, I can't see LCDs getting a whole lot better than this so buy with confidence.

Reviews.Title: So far I love it!
Reviews.Author: roguedog98
Reviews.Content: Have been eyeing TVs for over a year now and it never seemed the right time.  Was kinda ready to go with the 4065 when this came out.  Love all the inputs on this TV.  Really versatile.  Very smart to put some on the wide of the TV too.  Easy to access without messing up the lines of the tv.First time to order such a large, expensive product from Amazon but they really did a great job.  Love the free delivery as there'd have been no way for me to bring home something this size from the store anyway and local stores would have charged me.  Amazon had the best price and I think, the best service.Also Amazon's price matching program was great.  Helped me not get buyer's remorse when day later prices dropped since the 750s came out.Overall, great TV and great service from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: K. Lee
Reviews.Content: Excellent 1080P HDTV at a great price. Had been looking at 46" LCDs for several months. I really liked the Samsung 4665/4671 models that I saw. I wanted the 120Hz available in the 4671 but didn't want to pay the extra. Then I read an Amazon review of the new 2008 models so I went out to see them. The new 650 had 120Hz/4ms response/50K:1 contrast and was $700 less here than in retail stores. Briefly considered the 550, as it was even cheaper but lacked 120Hz and the 750 which adds MP3 playing but at significant cost. Decided if it was going to be online and delivered I trusted Amazon more than others. I would agree with any of the good reviews here in terms of the great picture quality, 4 HDMI connections etc. The red bevel coloring is quite subtle but along with the thinner surround adds to the good looks of the set. The glossy finish is only noticeable to me when the set is turned off and I have had no problems with reflections in daylight even though a window is close by.  I must also mention the CEVA delivery. Within a few days they were calling me to arrange delivery and were flexible with times. They also called 30 minutes before they actually arrived. My wife says they were very professional and courteous, unpacked the TV and set it up, plugged in the cables and showed her how to use it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, poor quality
Reviews.Author: K. Tokunaga-Chavez
Reviews.Content: After extensive research, I recommended this TV to my parents and had intended to purchase one myself, but my parents have had only headaches with this TV.  The TV automatically changes to the same NBC channel at 9:58pm every evening no matter what channel they're watching.  They did not "schedule" any program or time into the "scheduling section" of the TV.  The first attempt to contact Samsung resulted in a conversation that couldn't be understood because the call center was in India.  This person was of no help.  The next day, I called and spoke with someone in the States, he was polite, but couldn't really help.  The following day, my dad called and was told to disconnect the TV from the DVD player and see if that helped.  It didn't...so Samsung sent a its local repairman out to change a $500 part (circuit board I believe) to fix the problem.  Well, that didn't fix the problem. My parents eventually disconnected everything from the TV and connected the TV directly into the cable to see if the problem was having external components connected to their TV.  The problem still occurs so Samsung is sending their repairman to pickup the TV. They will try to fix the problem at their local shop, BUT in the mean time, MY PARENTS ARE LEFT WITHOUT A TV after having spent about $1500 on a brand new TV.  Don't waste your hard earned money on Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price and features
Reviews.Author: H. Al-Harethi
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for an HDTV for a while since the previous version of the this TV was in the market last year (the 71 series) and after searching and reading reviews on the net (here at amazon, [...] and other sites) I liked this TV so much and without hesitations I purchased it.Here are few things you need to think about when making your decision:1- When you see this TV on best buy or circuit city, you may not find it the best sometimes because of so much light and other brands around it. It makes it difficult to see what this TV is capable of.2- With Amazon price, delivery and service in general, stop shopping at your local electronics store as you're really wasting money. Amazon.com is the way to shop. I got this TV for $1619.99 and the price dropped to $1569.99 and amazon refunded my CC for the price difference. You have to know that Amazon.com policy has changed - as many other reviewers said - and they only guarantee the price you purchased for only a week later. Also, with the excellent service you get from CEVA, your purchase is taken care of and you can call them earlier to arrange and earlier delivery of your merchandise.3- I honestly thought the standard digital TV broadcasting will be ugly or blurry on this TV, but to the opposite. It was much better than my old TV and it was not disappointing at all. You definitely need an HD service to get the best of your TV.4- A lot of people gave this TV 4 stars of so because of the remote control or the glare and it really depends on how picky you're. I found the remote control to be tricky for few minutes but I got the hang of it quickly and did not find it difficult to operate though I may need to look at it to see what I should do. As far as the glare, I have had the TV for few days now and I have not seen what people are complaining about. If your window or light is behind you when you watch TV or you watch the TV from an angle, then definitely you will see light reflection. Adjust your light or watch the TV perpendicularly.7- The sound out-of-the-box for this TV is really good enough unless you have a movie theater or want your neighbors to call the police on you.6- As I mentioned above, with an HD service from your provider, you will enjoy watching anything on this TV. I got comcast HD receiver and I am connecting it to my TV via component cables (1080i signal) and I can't imagine watching this TV with SP3 or Blu ray.7- I am shooting for SP3 80GB as it is really an excellent choice for both blu-ray as well as a gaming system. I am not a gamer but looks like I will be on soon.Good luck with your purchase.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY A SAMSUNG T.V.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D. Filko
Reviews.Content: *************UPDATE Jan 2010 - SAMSUNG T.V. HAVE BAD CAPACITORS. IT WILL FAIL. IT WILL COST YOU AT LEAST $150.00 TO FIX, IF NOT MORE. SAMSUNG WILL NOT HELP YOU. DO NOT BUY ANY SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS. PROBLEM DOES NOT SHOW UP UNTIL ABOUT 13 MONTHS, JUST AFTER THE WARRANTY!!!! 5 CALLS TO CUSTOMER SERVICE, AND SAMSUNG REFUSES TO ACKNOWLEDGE THE ISSUE. THERE IS EVEN A CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT UNDERWAY. RECOMMEND NOT BUYING ANY SAMSUNG.**** ORIGINAL REVIEW - I researched Flat Panel Televisions for over a year. Based on reviews, hands-on testing, and a lot of consideration, we ordered this Unit 2 weeks ago. White glove service was great, and the guys had it set up and running in 15 minutes.For the price and features, you really can't beat this TV. I have not seen any of the issues that others have had, and I'd guess unless you are an extreme videophile, with all kinds of reference material and reference sources, you never would.The red color is just not noticiable unless you look closely, and then, its just kind of neat. So subtle, it goes with any decor.I'd highly recommend this unit.BTW, it's very very heavy, don't try to hang it on a wall mount yourself. I did, and very nearly lost the whole thing. My foot still hurts!*****************

Reviews.Title: Another Fast Delivery
Reviews.Author: dfarr
Reviews.Content: Like many of you I've read all the great reviews about this set and decided to pull the trigger when I saw the $1699 price.(which has since raised) Everything about the quality of the LN46A650 has already been said but the quality of the delivery service seems to get mixed reviews.I ordered my set on Sunday morning and it was delivered at noon on Wednesday. It was in perfect condition and actually delivered by an agent apparently contracted by CEVA. The driver was very pleasant and polite and stayed until I was happy that there were no problems with the set.Although very fast, the delivery didn't come without some major confusion from CEVA.CEVA seems to have some real issues knowing exactly where their items are. After reading about all the issues with CEVA on the Amazon forums I took the advice from those posts and called CEVA to set up my delivery rather than waiting for them to call me. I called them on Tuesday when I saw their tracking showed my set was in Philadelphia which is their closest terminal to my house. They set me up for Wednesday delivery. Late Wednesday morning I called to confirm delivery and was told that someone must have made a mistake and that my set was in Columbus Ohio. They then offered to set me up for Friday delivery.Within the hour I got a call from the delivery agent and was told they had my set on their truck and were on their way to deliver it.(now I was really confused)I asked them to have their driver call me so I could arrange to meet him. The truck showed up and miraculously had my TV that CEVA thought was still in Ohio.It gets better.....Later that evening I got a call from another driver that said he was going to deliver my TV tomorrow and wanted directions to my house.Bottom line....keep an eye on the CEVA tracking system and call to set up and confirm your delivery. If they seem confused or give you questionable information make sure you question it or call again and ask someone else. It seems their system works....they just don't know it.The set is awesome and the price here on Amazon is the best you'll find. As it turned out, even with the confusion I was thrilled with the fast delivery and ease of this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Warning!  Amazon no longer has 30 day price guarantee!!!
Reviews.Author: Ima Reader
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on Amazon and was comforted to know if that if the price dropped within 30 days (like at with local stores) that I could get a refund on that amount.WRONG!!!I bought my TV on Sept 23, 2008.  Apparently on Sept 21 Amazon changed its policy and no longer has a 30 day price guarantee.  Less than 2 weeks have passed since I purchased my TV and the price has dropped almost $100.  Had I realized that there wasn't going to be a price guarantee, I would have been MUCH more careful on checking price trends before I bought (or perhaps bought elsewhere online that supported a 30 day price guarantee).Because of reading the customer reviews, I thought that I was covered on that and didn't think anything about just going ahead and ordering when I did.Anyhow, just wanted to give you heads up on that so that you don't get caught like I did on it (or are at least informed about it -- I was misinformed).On the TV, we've had it less that 2 weeks and it has a great picture and glare hasn't been a problem (I had been concerned about that).  The sound isn't as good as I'd expect it to be for the price of a TV and we'll end up using a different sound system because of it.

Reviews.Title: Died after three years :(
Reviews.Author: Michael G. Sirilla
Reviews.Content: I would give this set zero stars if I could.This set was quite a heafty investment (for us) and we loved it!  Fantastic picture (except for sports games when there was noticeable motion blur), very decent sound, fairly easy to use.We purchased the set in 2008.  In late 2011, the set kept turning itself on and off automatically and the picture first became full of lines and then was gone altogether.  Samsung customer support sent out a tech to replace the capacitor (a free service since these sets have had that problem very often), but that didn't work.  Their estimate to repair the set was anywhere from $350 to over $1,000.  We decided to not repair the set since, if we blew the $350 and that repair didn't work, we'd have less money to put toward a new set (and we're NOT paying $1,000+ to repair a set that cost around that much).I just have to say that it's unbelievable that manufacturers make items like these that last for so short a time.  We have family members who have tvs from the 1970s and 80s that still work perfectly!  Sheesh!  Thanks a lot Samsung :(

Reviews.Title: Great While It Lasted :(
Reviews.Author: Mark W DeMouth
Reviews.Content: I too have had a disappointing experience with this TV. After three years of great performance the left side of the screen became dark and shadowy. A service technician diagnosed the problem as a bad panel which would cost more to replace than to buy a new set.  Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color

Reviews.Title: Set just went out
Reviews.Author: W. Quon
Reviews.Content: almost 2 year and 4 months and all of a sudden the set stop coming on, just a clicking sound.  I looked online and I see that there is a known issue with the capacitors going bad.  I will have to check my set and see if that is the case, but I have an older Toshiba rear projection 52 inch that has lasted for 10 years no problem.Beware of the Samsung, seems to be an issue from the internet search I did.

Reviews.Title: We all know its the best TV
Reviews.Author: Forecaster01 "Smart Shopper"
Reviews.Content: Its difficult to say anymore over the 800+ fav reviews.  But yes, I read most of them, did a lot of research before buying, and finally settled on this TV.  It is the best for the money and probably produces a better image than even more expensive models.Standard TV is great, bluray is excellent - all is mind blowing.  Just buy this TV at the best price you can find - stop waiting for better TVs.  You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: For the Money, the absolute best product on the market
Reviews.Author: Erich D. Hosbach "HOTT BOXX"
Reviews.Content: My new Samsung is an outstanding addition to my home entertainment system.  The piece is ready for whatever 'upgrades' come our way for the next few years so no buyer's remorse or feelings of anxiety about the item being obsolete in a few months.  The color is amazing, ease of use terific, but I just wish I could figure out how to make it stop playing the little jingle everytime you turn it on.  For LCD technology, this has got to be the best picture, quality, and value money can buy.  And the TOC, or that little touch of red around the cabinet; well I thought that was silly and useless and it did not play a factor in my decision to purchase; but wow does it look fantastic!  That bit of color takes the edge off of what would be a big black shiny electronic inside a beautiful antique cathedral amoire.  The red actually helps the transition from old world to modern and makes the tv feel more like a piece of furniture instead of a space age portal.  Well done, Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Best in class
Reviews.Author: Don Ruble
Reviews.Content: I researched 46" LCD wide-screens HDTVs thoroughly before this purchase and read all the reviews and comparisons. The Samsung LN46A650, 1080p,  120Hz was everything they claimed it to be, and I am completely satisfied. Better picture than Sony and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A650 review
Reviews.Author: R. Deshpande
Reviews.Content: I decided to buy Samsung LN46A650 LCD TV based on the reviews I have seen on Amazon and so far I am a happy customer, the product came in very good packaging and delivered before schedule, as I do most of my purchases from Amazon, will continue to do so in future too...good job Amazon.

Reviews.Title: MY MY....
Reviews.Author: Erik Knox
Reviews.Content: Holy cow.  The only thing I wish is that it was bigger.  Works perfectly, set up on the network with out a problem. The glare is not a problem unless I have direct sunlight commming into the room.  There are more connections in the back then the average person would ever need.  This also puts the pioneer elite on it's knees.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous TV!!
Reviews.Author: Toolman
Reviews.Content: Just received my Samsung TV on 2/16/09. Unbelievable picture! For all you folks considering this product: Don't sweat the negative comments you've heard. There's and old saying that your glass is either half empty, or half full. With this TV, you simply have to decide which it is.I've seen a reviews where the following complaints were lodged:TOC bezel was loose. (not on mine)Remote too sensitive/slow/etc.(personal opinion, glass half empty)Screen too reflective. Matte finish would be better. (glass half empty)A couple of fellows at a BestBuy I stumbled into said a matte finish dimishes color clarity to a slight degree and glare could easily be reduced by drawing the curtains and tilting the unit down 2-3 degrees without noticable loss of clarity. I'll accept both claims.Unit shuts off by itself. (not on mine yet. If it does, I'll download the software patch from Samsung and be back on track)Inadequate speakers. (glass half empty. These speakers will play loud enough to annoy all the neighbors just like any other TV in the showroom.If sound is the critical issue, turn your home theater system on.)Basically, after reading dozens of tech. reviews, hundreds of comments from Amazon buyers, and sending dozens of big-box store associates running for cover when I walk through the door AGAIN to sniff and fondle every unit mounted to the wall, I took the plunge. I fear buyer's remorse more than I fear cancer, and I have no remorse over this decision. The only thing I would caution a potential buyer about is deciding between the 46 and 52 inch models. Once I placed mine, I realized I had room for the 52 inch unit. Damn! But that's ok. Seeing how the 46 in. model makes me behave like a deer caught in the headlights, it's safe to assume the 52 in. would have forced me to quit my job and resort to a feeding tube and catheter.You can find reasons to love or hate any TV you'll consider buying. They all have their strenghts and weaknesses. In my humble opinion: Buy the LN46A650, share it, and enjoy it for years to come. And thank you all for posting your comments on Amazon for the rest of us to ponder.

Reviews.Title: Good LCD, Not as good as Panasonic Plasma for same $$$
Reviews.Author: Mrgold35 "MRGold"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased in Feb/09 a Samsung LN-46A650 1080p 46inch LCD HDTV ($1580 with shipping) to replace the old +2 year old 42" Panasonic TH-42PX600U plasma downstairs.  I've heard and read how much the LCDs have caught up the plasma in picture quality and I decided to give the top rated Samsung a chance.  I belong to a Audio/Visual forums and I downloaded the calibration settings from other Samsung owners that had their set professionally calibrated.The only advantages the Samsung had was 4 HDMI inputs, swivel base, and a larger screen by 4 inches, after that is was all Panasonic.  The +2 year old Panasonic had a sharper HD/SD picture quality, superior sound quality, faster start up, quicker HDMI channel changes, easier to calibrate and it required less tweaking depending on SD/HD signal.  After one week, I had to return the Samsung because it just wasn't worth spending that much money for decreased image/sound quality.  I replaced the Samsung with the Panasonic 58 inch 1080p TH-58PZ800U ($2,089 + $200 5 day ground shipping).Pros:- Very wide range of color adjustments- Very deep blacks- Excellent DVD and Blue-ray image with up-converted PS3 and Denon S-301 home theater.  This TV shines at 1080p!- Attractive design- Very lightCons:- Depending on signal, SD can be a little grainy and HD can be a little unclear (fuzzy edges, hazy eyes, blurry hair, softer overall look)- Glare/reflection because of smooth screen it was more of problems compared to my Panasonic Plasma.- Depending on the SD/HD channel, I had to constantly tweak the image quality because each HD/SD channel was different.  Could not set it and forget it like on the Panasonic.- Sound quality was difficult to adjust to a rich full sound, sounded like the speakers were too small for the unit.- The sound on the TV was delayed and produced an echo when using TV and home theater speakers. I had to turn off the TV speakers when using the surround sound system.- Limited viewing angle, colors start to degrade and wash out if you are more than 45 degrees either side.- Slight delay in switching channels with HDMI, had to change to component cables to speed up channel changing.- The 120 MHz motion setting produces an image quality similar to watching a soap opera.  I had to turn it off because it was distracting.

Reviews.Title: GREATEST TV I'VE EVER OWNED.
Reviews.Author: B. Sweet "Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV last weekend after researching several reviews on-line.  I spent hours [...]  going through different Tv's, but this one kept popping up as one I had wanted to buy. I had pretty much decided that no matter what the screen glare or the scroll wheel button they were referring to; to be a problem, this was my TV.  Cnet compared it to Samsung's 52" and they said it was the most amazing picture they had ever seen.Once I turned this TV on, I realized what they meant.  The picture is Phenomenal right out of the box.  The black levels are very good and the colors are very brilliant.  I sit back 9.5 feet from the TV and was contemplating getting this one or the 40"  I am glad I decided to go with the 46"  It has a built in ethernet port or you can buy Samsung's wireless adapter to use the internet feature, something that was a selling point for me.  However, still to this day, I haven't really tried doing this because I have TIVO, which does all of that for me.I love that it has many HDMI slots, one for my TIVO, and one for my ROKU player to stream my Netflix movies.  I have already streamed several High Def HD movies through Netflix on this TV and it is amazing.We had to take it out of the box to get it to fit in my tiny Toyota Corolla and at that point, I did not see any dominant red with the "Touch of Color" with this TV.  Someone else described it perfect.  It is a very subtle, but deep red like a wine color you will not even notice unless there is a lot of light in the room.The TV does have a bit of a glare in a dark room, or when watching movies that are mostly dark in color.  I can see this being a problem for someone else who sits as close as myself to the TV and has friends over and they would need to view it at an angle instead of head on, especially if there is any sunlight in the room.  My house is mostly dark so I haven't experienced a huge issue with that.The remote leaves a little to be desired with it's wheel function, similar to an IPOD.  It does work, it just needs a steady hand.  Even if you aren't using the wheel function, you can still press the wheel down to the left, right, up, or down, which I find easier for me than trying to use the wheel.  It still "skips" sometimes and is something I am not fond about from this TV.  Looks like Samsung will continue using the wheel remote in the future according their website, even with 2009 models.I gave this TV a perfect five, because I watch TV for TV, not the remote.  The picture is outstanding, and the price was great. The HD channels are brilliant and the 120MHZ make standard channels look amazing too.This television has a built in Qualcomm tuner, so I was able to get more channels than I ever did when originally hooking it up directly to the cable line. That was a huge bonus.I'm very happy with my purchase.  Samsung won my vote.

Reviews.Title: One of the best pictures ever!!! (If calibrated correctly)
Reviews.Author: Josue Rodriguez "Sway"
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best pictures I have ever seen on a tv. Sony has nothing on Samsung in this price range. There is a reason why this is the best selling tv on amazon.com.Pros:- Very good color and contrast (If calibrated. See below for the calibration that I used)- Semi Gloss screen adds to color depth- Auto Motion Plus 120Hz gives an unbelievable clarity to "live video" recordings (i.e. sports, news, etc.)- This tv is awesome for gaming.Cons:- Semi gloss screen does reflect ambient light. So if you are easily annoyed by seeing a reflection of a lamp or window, then you might want to consider the LN46A630 model which does not have the glossy screen. In my opinion, the extra clarity that the glossy screen gives the picture is completely worth having some glare. You do get used to it after a day or two.- Auto Motion Plus 120Hz does not look good for DVD, Blu-ray, or any film source. The problem is that AMP 120Hz makes the picture look too good...you lose that "film" quality of movies. When turned on, especially on high, it seems as though you are watching something completely fake. The good news is that this feature can be turned to low/med/high or off. This is more of a disclaimer than a con for that reason.Now for the good stuff... The picture calibrations I am using is for a tv that is in a moderately bright room. I personally prefer rich color, but not too exaggerated. I found some professional settings online and then tweaked them to my liking.Mode: MovieBacklight: 5Contrast: 93Brightness: 43Sharpness: 10Color: 57Tint: G50/R50Detailed SettingsBlack Adjust: offDynamic Contrast: offGamma: +3Color Space: AutoWhite BalanceR-Offset: 25G-Offset: 26B-Offset: 25R-Gain: 24G-Gain: 23B-Gain: 20Flesh Tone: 0Edge Enhancement: OnxvYCC: offPicture OptionsColor Tone: Warm1 (you may prefer Warm2 for movies)Size: Just Scan (if available, if not, then 16:9.)  You definitely want it on for dvd, blu-ray, and gaming.Digital NR: AutoDNle: offHDMI Black Level: Low (if applicable)Film Mode: On (if applicable)Blue Only Mode: offAuto Motion Plus 120Hz: mostly Off, only ON for sportsI hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with tv and Amazon service
Reviews.Author: W. Oliver
Reviews.Content: I've had this television for one month now and overall I am very pleased. The picture is just amazing, very bright with vivid colors. Watching a dvd (especially a Blue-Ray dvd) is a thrilling experience. Likewise, channels that are broadcast in high definition, also look phenomenal (FoodTv, Discover, Science and History Channel are standouts). I have found that channels that are not broadcasd in HD look very bad and I've had problems with setting ratio aspects on some channels but I realize that this is not an issue with the tv itself. The setup and menus are very easy to follow. Like some other reviewers have mentioned, the sound is not that great so I purchased a sound system to go with it and actually turned the sound off the tv because it interferred with the sound system speakers. Now, I just need a good international remote (I'm now using 4!).The delivery service was fine. I received the set exactly one week after I ordered it. I received a call one day prior to delivery telling me that it would be delivered the next day between 12pm and 5pm. It arrived at 12:30pm.

Reviews.Title: Great Television!
Reviews.Author: Bobby Dallis
Reviews.Content: If you are researching televisions like I did for months, don't waste anymore of your time. I know you keep coming back to this television and with good reason, it's simply the best on the market and at a great price. The TOC is beautiful in a appearance, has an outstanding picture, great sound and plenty of ports to hook-up all your other toys! Also, if your worried about the "glare issue" that some reviews have stated and for that reason delayed me purchasing the TOC, forget about it! I have many windows and lamps in my living area and yes you can see reflection when the television if off but unless you are just looking for it, you will never notice reflection while it's turned on.This is a wonderful televison that has me thinking of how great it actually is every time I turn it on. I will however list a few minor complaints just for review purposes. The remote is not built for quality. Samsung has put an iPod wheel on the remote but without the quality of Apple. I have a satellite and use that remote anyway. The second minor complaint is that you can clean the TOC and the next day it will have noticeable dust on it again.In conclusion this is a regret free purchase that I will enjoy for years to come. If you want the best televison for the best price you will not beat the TOC. I would suggest Amazon to be your seller as well. You don't have to pay top dollar like you would at a brick & mortar retail store.

Reviews.Title: Best in its class
Reviews.Author: The Bigmac
Reviews.Content: I've rated this product based upon what matters to me the most: Picture quality. in this department this product is best in it's class, rivaled only by the Sony XBR line which comes in second place.Picture quality is simply..........Perfect. The best money can buy. If you're a gamer, this is your set hands down, if you're not a gamer, you could go for cheaper alternatives like plasmas, but why compromise? If you can afford it, buy it. Finest set on the market.  Creme de la creme. Cream of the crop. Period.I purchased this set for my secondary setup. In my dinning room. (My main setup is in my bedroom with the 52" version of this same set).I only have 1 minor gripe: The remote. Samsung tried literally to reinvent the wheel and failed miserably. For me, this is a non issue, since my dinning room setup is controlled by the satellite box remote but in case you're going to actually use the TV's remote, you should know the remote's functionality with the little wheel is just broken. I didn't consider this small detail a setback important enough to remove any stars from the rating. Doing so would be like buying a 50 million G5 airplane and saying the plane is terrible because you didn't like the cupholders. If the remote happens to be just unbearable for you, any Samsung LCD remote from 3 years ago or newer will work just fine. Just order a replacement remote off ebay for about 20 bukcs and end of story.  For 20 bukcs more you made an almost perfect set, perfect. Done. It's fixable.Have in mind 99% of your hard earned money is going towards picture quality here. And only 1% is going towards the hideous remote. Opt for a different set with a better remote, and there won't be any 20 dollar accessory you can buy off ebay that will get you out of that hole. You will be stuck with sub par picture quality for good. The same goes to people who knock stars off the ratings of TV sets because they don't have good speakers. The sound on this set is pretty good but if this happens to be your main set, where you will be watching your movies, or if you are demanding with sound, then you own a decent home theater, RIGHT?_____________________________________EDIT 04/29/09I recently came Across an Issue this TV suffers from and it's a split second lag when it comes to gaming content, specially first person shooters. If you want to read more about this, check my other reviews and find my review of the LN52A750 where I posted a video review comparing the 650 line vs the 750.To sum it up, if you play 1st person shooters, knock a star off this review. If you don't, this TV is as good as it gets in this price range.  If you want a lag free video game experience, go for the 750 series.

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Amazing Picture
Reviews.Author: James A. Smith "iflyplanes"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung 46" 650 about a month ago, the picture on this tv is amazing, the quality rivals that of more expensive sets that i have looked at. while the picture is amazing, the sound is good as well, but could be improved, the addition of a small sub to the unit would be a nice addition.Playing PS# and watching Blu Ray Movies is just breath taking and makes these activites much more enjoyably.now the Cons:Switching between Input sources takes a few seconds, while this isnt a problem just a minor annoyance when you wanna watch tv NOW! lolThe remote leaves alot to be desired.  the ipod style click wheel is a great idea, if it worked better, it makes navigating menus a bit tricky at times.All in all this set gets 5 stars, the value is unbeatable, the picture is AMAZING and i couldnt be happier.  you will not be disapointed in this TV, its a Great Buy!

Reviews.Title: "White glove delivery" rocks, too
Reviews.Author: Pecos Bill
Reviews.Content: I've always worried about ordering stuff like this through Amazon.  I likely won't be home when UPS delivers it and I'm not sure it will fit in my car if I have to go pick it up, and even that would be best done with 2 people since it's a sizable box.Well, I ordered it Friday and on Tuesday some guy called me and said, "I have your TV on my truck.  Are you going to be home this evening?"  He brought it over around 6pm and took it out of the box.  It was too cold to turn it on immediately but I definitely appreciate the delivery service ("white glove" seems to equal "some dude with a truck".  It's not UPS/USPS.  Consequently you can get a lot more flexibility in when you want it delivered.  I hope this is a service Amazon plans to get more use out of, as limitations on UPS/USPS are why I don't order more big things through them.)The TV itself seems to be fantastic.  It does actually have internal speakers, too.  They aren't great but they'll do until I've had a chance to go out and buy some real speakers.  There's basically no setup and the menus are a good deal more intuitive than my old TV.  The TV is pretty heavy but for being 46" I can still lift it myself.The picture quality is perfect and it's a fantastic display for my XBox 360 too.All in all I don't think I could be more pleased with either the price, the delivery or the TV itself.Update:The funny thing about this TV?  It's *TOO* good.You remember watching, say, Dr. Who, the old one back in the day?  It kinda had cheesy production value.  You could just look at it and see that it wasn't up to specs with high budget sci-fi.This TV makes modern shows I was happy with suddenly look low production, because it ramps up the detail so high.  I was watching Stargate Atlantis on this TV on the SciFi HD channel and I was instantly reminded of Dr. Who.  It brings out the detail so much that flaws in lighting and so forth become more obvious.You just can't beat it when watching a watching a high-dollar movie on Blu-Ray, though.  Absolutely amazing.  Far superior even to my older rear projection HD TV.  They both do 1080i but this one simply has a far superior picture.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Douglas Brown "Chris B"
Reviews.Content: As I was finishing up my clinicals and looking for a house or apartment, I spent almost a year looking at HD-TVs, reading reviews, and drolling.  I decided that I liked LCD TVs the best.  the Samsung TV had the same quality as TVs well above it's price.  It has several nice features that other TVs of it's price did not have.  When my aunt got this TV the difference between the TV my brother got was apparently.  The Samsung had richer colors and blacker blacks.  I could go on & on, but if you compare the details tab with that of other TVs you'll see what I'm talking about.  I love my new TV & my Wife told me to pick whichever TV I wanted & this is the one 'we' chose.  Yea, she's pretty awesome ;).  I got it with a free Blue Ray player and if the price dropped they would credit our account.The Shipping was great, they were pretty much on time, they did all of the lifting, unpacking, Plugging things in and making sure the TV worked & the picture was good.I highly recommend it!Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with RED Touch of Color

Reviews.Title: Exceeded My Expectations
Reviews.Author: Kerry "sgtkerrye"
Reviews.Content: Overall, a great LCD set that exceeded my expectations.  I purchased this several weeks ago and really have no complaints.  It has a great hi-def picture, great color, sound, deep blacks, etc.  After ordering, I was a bit concerned that the red hue on the set would be too much, but it is very subtle and not very noticeable.If I had to make the choice over, I would buy it again.  Definitely a great buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: After reading all 504 reviews over the past few weeks I'm finally going to post my own.
Reviews.Author: Flowerman
Reviews.Content: First the Pilot folks who delivered my set were really nice folks.....They carried the set in, unpacked it, put it on the table (the swivel stand was already assembled) then hooked up my Dish DVR with the coaxial cable, they even put the batteries for the remote in and handed it to me...I turned it on, heard that switch/on sound I've heard folks talk about on here and when I saw that big old beautiful screen light up I was smiling from ear to ear.....I did the initial setup set up and everything went fine.....The Dish folks aren't coming till Wednesday to upgrade my dish and DVR to HD but my wife and I are both tickled to death with the SD programming we've seen so far....I fine tuned the sound for my taste as far as you can with the TV speakers and it sounds OK but really looking forward to setting up my surround sound system and Blu-ray player next week. One or two other things, we both like the red touch of color as it matches the decor of our bedroom such as it is.....I bought this  TV when it was $1606, not long after I ordered it, the next day I think the price dropped below $1500!....I called Amazon and they were very nice and told me due to the precipitous drop in price (not usual as I understood them say) they cheerfully and without argument gave me a refund immediately....Between the good folks from PIlot, the TV itself, the way we were treated by Amazon, free shipping and no tax, well I reckon I'm just one happy camper. I've read many good reviews of the 650 on here and I'm happy to be adding my own today....I hope all you folks who haven't gotten yours yet will have as much satisfaction as we have had with our purchase. The college football bowl games coming up, a Humphrey Bogart movie festival on TCM this month, lots of great holiday programming, all new HD channels and the Super Bowl in February, I may not leave this room till spring........:)

Reviews.Title: Perfection Of LCD
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Moore
Reviews.Content: This LCD is nearing perfection.  The only thing, at all, I would change is the ability to port the video settings from one input to the rest.  The video settings are stored for each individual source.  It would be nice, but otherwise everything else is as good as it gets.  A very good LCD.

Reviews.Title: I owe this review to you
Reviews.Author: Jason Pandolfo
Reviews.Content: I spent months (July-Oct) reading reviews on amazon everyday waiting in anticipation for the next update/price movement. I pulled the trigger in October and so happy I did. What an amazing TV and I owe Amazon/Samsung a review! Only suckers buy TVs at Best Buy or Circuit City. In fact, I went to the local CC and even the sales guy told me he bought on Amazon! Even with his discount, he did better.  Picture is just perfect and I love the very classy touch of color...so subtle and sometimes I wish the red showed more. No glare what so ever on the 6. I had a Philips LCD 720p previously and I cant even watch it now. Yes, the remote is annoying and it's wheel doesnt respond well but its not worth complaining about. The sound is poorly designed but who doesnt run a TV like this through a home theater system? Sound is still OK for regular TV watching but you need some type of speaker system to compliment this TV for movie watching. Ive grown to love the 120hz and even when it appears to project the "soap opera" effect on movies or TV. I watch Seinfeld everynight in HD and Cramer jumps into my living saying "Hey Buddy". I didnt get the white glove service..just unpacked the TV myself, plugged in my HDMI connection to the cable box and I had the TV running in 20 mins. It looks great out of the box and I used CNET.com for additional setting ideas.

Reviews.Title: An easy worry-free tranaction for an amazing product!
Reviews.Author: T. Migliaccio
Reviews.Content: GENERAL: I must admit that I was a bit skeptical about ordering such a high-dollar product online; however the transaction went smooth, fast and I wouldn't hesitate doing it again, or recommending it to someone else. The TV was $600 less than I could purchase it at any local retailer; and it was well worth the five-day wait to get it at home.SHIPPING: I placed my order on a Thursday, and had my new TV the following Tuesday. I will say that it only had to ship from PA to NH; thus it wasn't too far away. I checked the status of the shipment daily, and when I saw it arrived at the local hub, I called the shipping company myself to set up the delivery. The delivery arrived within the scheduled time block, and the gentlemen who brought the TV into my house, did it with "white gloves."PRODUCT: I am thrilled with the new TV; it's everything the reviews said it was, and set-up was a snap. I'll re-visit this post once I've had it longer, to give further feedback.
