I was also a bit worried about the "touch of color," being too strong; honestly it's very subtle and not nearly as obvious as the online images make it appear.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great value
Reviews.Author: The Flash "Joey"
Reviews.Content: I've been looking at buying a Sony 46XBR4 for about a year, before I chanced on this unit at a local Best Buy. The colors were very sharp, there was hardly a glare, the TOC was unique and the price was fantastic. I've had this unit for close to a month now and switched from Comcast to Direct TV HD. The picture and sound are just beyond my expectations. I've hooked up my xbox360, ps2 and wii quickly. This TV has also improved xbox360 gameplay images and sounds. The images from the xbox360 dvd player are very, very sharp. I watch a lot of tennis and other sports in HD and the quality is lifelike. Also, I actually like the remote but use Direct TV's remote already. I have no firmware issues.  I ordered this unit on a Monday afternoon and got delivery by Thursday noon. I just have one advice -- buy it !

Reviews.Title: Very good TV
Reviews.Author: Netgurutoo "Netgurutoo"
Reviews.Content: I bought my Samsung in August and have had any problems. I read some turn off and they need a software upgrade but I have not had that issue. The picture is very good even without HD channels. It seems to improve the picture I get terrible Comcast cable coming in.Overall I am happy with the TV

Reviews.Title: Love it....
Reviews.Author: Steve P. Weldin "tweldin"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I looked at lots of LCD TV's and discovered that picking one out is not as easy as it looks.  So, after doing lots of research on contrast ratio, rms, and comparing like features we decided on the Samsung Series 6 model.  It was easy to hook up, the blacks are black and the colors just pop! We were hesitant about ordering online instead of buying locally, but Amazon's White Glove delivery servce was fantastic and we had no problems.  We would recomend the Samsung LN46A650 to anyone.  If you need more information Samsung has a great website that explains all their LCDs and what their features mean.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV, Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Bookworm6772 "JLS"
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this TV and am very impressed with it. I admit I was nervous about purchasing such a large expensive item online, but when I started comparing prices, there was no contest. I estimate I saved at least $500 buying from Amazon rather then a typical brick and mortar store. I live in California so just the savings in sales tax was more then enough to cover the cost of shipping. Although I had to wait a week for delivery the white glove service was outstanding and the dollar savings was well worth the extra time!As for the television itself, it's a dream. the picture quality is outstanding-crisp, clear, and because it's an LCD it's glare free. Even when it's turned off it's a beautiful piece, the deep red glass surrounding the LCD screen is gorgeous.I have DirectTV upgraded to HD and the quality is simply amazing. All I needed to get going was an HDMI cable (given to me by Direct TV when they did my upgrade)and a power strip. I plugged the set in, turned it on and was mesmerized for the whole weekend.I also purchased a Samsung Blu-ray disc player which was a snap to install using another HDMI cable (purchased through Amazon) and with a compatible remote control everything works seamlessly together.A great product. I highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazon Great - Glad I went with the Samsung LN46A650
Reviews.Author: Chris D. Webb "Chris SE Utah"
Reviews.Content: I first looked at the high ends Sharp versus the high end Samsung - side by side the Samsung came out on top with me.  With the introduction of the  Samsung LN46A850&950 the price on the 650 & 750 model's dropped - I considered upgrading and paying the extra money and going to the 850 or 950 models.  Since I already had a subwoofer I didn't need one built in and the connectivity and everything else I wanted and would use is already on the 650 model.  In addition - seeing the model's side by side - I liked the beveled edge look better than the newer models square look design.  The picture and quality are identical with the now - more expensive model's.  Unless they make more significant  upgrades, and unless you need a blue touch of color versus a red touch of color - I recommend going with the 650.  Delivered to the house for just over $1,500 is a great deal.  Amazon was great as usual - the TV showed up quickly and in great shape.  I paid $40 more than going with a unknown supplier - from the reviews I have read - it was well worth the difference to have the security of Amazon backing up my purchase.  I wish I had the space to go with the 52 inch.

Reviews.Title: Samsung + Amazon = AwesomeFinity
Reviews.Author: Mango "Mango"
Reviews.Content: Um, yeah. The TV is a work of art. The price, delivery and Amazon financing were the best anywhere. The 650 (6-Series) IS the sweet spot of the Samsung 46" lineup. The 7 just has some silly marketing features and frankly the 8 isn't much better. Go 6!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: M. Koeppen
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking around for a good tv.  After reading many reviews and all the horror stories I decided to go with the 650 series.  Great picture right out of the box, you can play with some of the settings if you want to adjust to your room. Spoil yourself on some HD channels or HD gaming.  SD tv will never look the same.On a side note find out who your white glove shipper is and contact them about the delivery date, I got my tv 4 days before the "estimate" date doing so.

Reviews.Title: What a WAY to SHOP
Reviews.Author: S. Pino
Reviews.Content: 1st purchase ever on Amazon!! Amazing Tv. Found Amazon's pricing changing frequently up 1 day, down 2 days later,up again,etc. Seen the lowest Amazon price at $1579. highest $1818. in the 1st half of Sept 08.I paid $1649 Sept 12. I Saw $1579. about 3 days later. BTW Amazon as of Sept 1st 08, no longer has a 30 day price match. I was NOT able to get a $70. credit. Amazon did a GOOD job with timely shipping, and the White Glove Delivery serice co. (CEVA) also. After 2weeks of box store and online shopping for LN46A650. I decided to make my 1st big purchase online. No other reputable co. could beat Amazon's price. (BEWARE of Low Price Co. Do your research 1st.) No Tax, FREE Delivey and Set-up. What a WAY to SHOP! Picture is jaw dropping. I have it with a Onkyo HT-S6100 HTIB (Home Theather in Box) purchase from Vann's thru Amazon for $579. No Tax, FREE Shipping. What a WAY to SHOP!! Timely delivered to my door!! (Box weights 91 lbs.) What a WAY to SHOP!!. WHAT NEXT?? mmm BLU-RAY?? After another week of reading reviews and debating which blu-ray player to INVEST in. The $399 PS3 thru Amazon made a wiser choice then buying a lower price stand alone blu-ray player. I am NOT into video Games, but PS3 has alot to offer.(check it out). Hooked it all up with Fios HD. Everyone was amazed. TV picture quality is outstanding. NO Problems what so ever. However the bezel is a dust magnet, TV runs warm to hot, out the top. (be sure to leave ample space above TV to release heat). Took 1 star away for lousy remote. I have recommened this purchase and my Amazon experience to some friends. Not sure other than not having internet access why anyone would buy at a big box stores, where you have to pay sales tax, and handle & transport your large heavy purchases.WHAT A WHY TO SHOP!! GO AMAZON!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome purchase
Reviews.Author: J. Capillo
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to buy such a large ticket item online, but I couldn't resist the price. It was $600 below any of the stores that I visited. I really did my research on the t.v. and I knew that the Samsung was the one that I wanted.I was nervous about the shipping, too, and the shipping date I was given was a week and a half out. Surprised the heck out of me when the shipping company, CEVA, called me two days after the purchase and told me they wanted to deliver the t.v. that afternoon!  They showed up on time, uncrated the t.v., put it on the stand and were gone. I was amazed.The t.v. is everything I knew and hoped it was, and it is a great addition.  I am very pleased with the whole transaction and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Now I'm a firm believer of the samsung screen
Reviews.Author: Vivien Von
Reviews.Content: With so many detailed reviews about this TV, I won't comment more but just to add a little point for what I see from my TV. At the beginning I was always skeptical about the shiny screen samsung are using these days on the TOC series. Since the place where I put my TV is facing two huge windows and it's always very bright during the day. I was worried that I might get reflections from the window. After a few month I purchased this TV I think this is not a problem at all. The screen was so bright and crystal clear that I never found the reflections a issue to me. Even with darker screens the samsung was not so horrible as I thought before. Most the reflections are very weak, the screen seems to have reduced the reflections somehow so not all lights were mirror-like reflected. I am so happy that I bought this one TV and I can see huge picture quality difference by looking at my old 19" LCD PC monitor and this new LCD TV. The pictures are more even toned, more vibrant and just crystal clear.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Cary Berdy
Reviews.Content: Delivery service is great. TV is unreal. I had the 550 for 2 weeks and decided to return it for the 650. WOW. There really is a huge difference- the 120hz & 4ms response combined with the AMP (auto-motion plus) make the picture sooooo much better. The AMP can be turned off/on or set to low/med/high. It's really great for sports and nature shows (like documentaries- Planet Earth, or Survivor), makes regular sitcoms, etc. seem kind of "soap opera-like." It almost looks too real, scary. But if you don't like this effect (which I really do) its easily turned off. Please do yourself a favor and spend the extra few $$$ and go for the 650 over the 550, it's more than worth it and am so happy I made that decision. The glossy screen looks amazing and not sure why people complain about it. Only glare that comes is when the TV is off, and I don't watch it when it's off so who cares. Buy some blinds if glare is a problem. The Touch of Color red effect is barely noticeable, it seems more prevalent in the pictures on here than in actual life. Looks good IMO, and seems more state of the art than the 550 edge.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: MP24
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied with this TV.  It's definitely a 5 star product by itself, add the good price and its even better. Two things I'd like to mention: 1. The delivery was ahead of schedule which was great, however I was dissapointed with the service during delivery.They called to schedule, gave me a time window, I was in the middle of something else so I said if at all possible please have the driver come towards the end of that time interval.  She said oh that's fine it may even be helpful to the driver. He didnt come later instead he came early. There was only one delivery guy, which meant I had to help him up the stairs to the second floor.  Additionaly, contrary to what most have said he advised me to keep the box for two weeks instead of taking the open box with him.  He just put the TV on, snowy picture and all and says ok it works please sign here. So I hooked everything up as he watched, made sure it worked then signed.He just wanted to get the heck outta there, which is fine, but free or not it was far from white glove delivery. I'm sure I'm one of the few, I'm just venting.2. TV - The Automotion Plus feature is great.  But as I think someone may have already mentioned, it takes some time to get used to if you're transitioning from an older HDTV.  I put Automotion on low and that seems to be a good medium.Overall it's a 5-star product but I was just really dissapointed with delivery.Update: 1-6-10...I've had this tv for almost a year and a half now and its been great and still is great.  No  issues to speak of.  The picture quality is awesome(esp. with blu ray).  There have been about three more people in my family to buy this tv after watching mine.  The newer models coming out now (240htz) are of course slightly better but that happens.  You cant go wrong with Samsung when it comes to hdtv's.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV, no price protection ANYMORE SINCE SEPT. 1
Reviews.Author: Gerald R. Williams "Amazon user"
Reviews.Content: After many months of research I chose the LN46A650, its great, no regrets.I suggest that regarding shipment, track the progress and CALL the shipper CEVA to arrange for the delivery, they did not call me after I saw it at their dock for 1 day, it took 8 days from ordering to delivery, where on checkout it said 3-5, however if you read the fine print it varies.A great BIG issue with Amazon.com however, after reading other feedback regarding their price protection where other customers called in and received a refund of the difference they paid following price reductions, when I called on Sept. 29 and asked for the $70.90 price reduction difference, customer service politely replied SOL, we discontinued that on Sept 1, so that is a minus for Amazon.com and a bit deceptive that it was just discontinued.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Judy G. Carter "judro"
Reviews.Content: Got this TV yesterday and man what a picture. Easy setup. Great price. Had bought a Sharp 46" 120hz 82U Had to return due to a bad pixel in the tube. This samsung blows it away not even close. As far as the glare is concern I see no glare with the TV on. when the set is off you can see the glare....But i do not watch it when it is off.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST TV IN THE MARKET!
Reviews.Author: Rex R. Davadilla
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV through Amazon.com and was delivered by CEVA 9 days after order was placed. CEVA took it out of the box, put it in my TV stand and turned it on. I was told to call them if there's anything wrong with the TV during the 30-day period and that they will pick it up free of charge.This TV is much, much better than any plasma or LCD TV in the market. Don't pay attention to these TV critics who gave it so-so or even bad reviews - they're just trying to appear knowledgeable and important. I've had it for 2 weeks and I'm still in love with it. My recommendation: get a blu-ray player and use HDMI cables - you'll appreciate how great this tv much, much more.

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: QT901
Reviews.Content: Simply the best picture available .Go to all the Best Buys, Circuit Citys, And all the mall stores, Compare this picture with all the best. Then come to Amazon for your purchase. Comments about glare are unfounded.  An absolute joy to experience .

Reviews.Title: Just buy one
Reviews.Author: D. Ellenberger
Reviews.Content: Moving from a 37" Vizio (which was very competent) to this TV was dramatic.  The Vizio got the job done but this thing is on another level.  Samsung must calibrate this thing before they ship it, because settings out of the box are wonderful.  It really is an exceptional TV - if you are undecided, buy it.I can't imagine LCD technology getting much better than this.  Mass production OLED technology is still two or three years away, so buy this with confidence.  As for the AMP motion smoothing technology, I prefer to keep it on low - anything higher and the images take on an almost 'unreal' quality that is impressive on the showroom floor, but over the course of a two hour movie I feel severely distort the 'feel' the film.  Of course you have the option to turn the AMP off.  The 120Hz almost does enough itself to smooth out images, making the AMP unnecessary.I am feeding this through a Time Warner box and playstation 3 for blu-ray.  Both are exceptional.  Get one.

Reviews.Title: Kudos to Samsung and Amazon
Reviews.Author: Irish Bearcat
Reviews.Content: I will echo everyone else in the comments about how fabulous the picture is.  It is nearly impossible to describe the clarity and detail.What I really want to do is give a shout out to Amazon for its service.  I previously ordered this TV from Abes of Maine 3 months ago.  Over 3 weeks, I was delivered 2 sets that both had broken screens upon delivery.  I think that the FedEx driver might have been the main culprit in the damage because I witnessed their driver flipping the box end over end as he placed it in my garage (and this might have happened multiple times because I was never forewarned when they would deliver).  Nonetheless, Abe's contracted with FedEx (for which I paid more in shipping) to deliver the TVs and placed the sets in large unmarked boxes so it bears some responsibility, too.  Regardless, the amount of time and mental energy I spent in dealing with the deliveries, returns, and refund process is incalculable and I would never use Abe's again because of it.Amazon hired a local delivery company which called to set up a delivery time 3 days after I ordered the set and then had 2 men quickly and carefully bring the set to my office the next day.  If I had known how careful and professional the delivery would be, I would have had them deliver to my house, but I was feeling snake bitten after the Abe's/FedEx snafu and wanted to make sure that there was only 1 delivery attempt, not the multiple FedEx attempts which led to damaged screens.Love the TV.  Love Amazon.

Reviews.Title: LN46A650
Reviews.Author: Ritteach
Reviews.Content: Pros-  Excellent value,timely delivery and set up.No problems with  CEVA(Hudson Valley)  Beautiful picture,easy to navigateCon- Glossy screen (reflects too much light in a multi window  setting-can be overcome by angling the set)Conclusion-Amazon is much better than BB or CC.

Reviews.Title: WOW!!! Amazing!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Sanchez
Reviews.Content: Purchased this product 2 weeks ago after searching for over a year on which large screen LCD to buy.  After many, many hours of research and reading.  I decided to pull the trigger on the Samsung LN46A650 and I couldn't be happier.When I first received the TV was a little apprehensive about what the picture was going to look like, because I was going to have to wait about a week before Direct TV could come and hook up the HD, so I was going to be stuck with SD.  When I hooked it up and turned it on...WOW...amazing!!!  The Standard Definition looked, IMO extremely good, and made the week while I was waiting for DTV a non issue.  When DTV hooked up the HD...the picture was, needless to say...stunning!I have had the TV now for 2 weeks and have had 0 problems...no dead pixels...no turning on and off like the older sets.  The delivery was very fast, although I only got the "work glove" delivery rather than the "white glove" that was advertised due to the fact CEVA does not deliver to my area and sub-contracts the delivery to a different company.  The service was still good...but was expecting it to be unpacked and fired up to insure it was properly working, instead it was "heres your TV, sign here please, have a great day!".It should be noted that CEVA was extremely friendly and helpfull to work with when setting up delivery time.It also should be noted that I was so pleased with the service and product that I just recently ordered a 32" Samsung LCD for the bedroom.  I am confindent that my first go around was not a fluke...so don't hesitate...PULL THE TRIGGER!!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung does it again
Reviews.Author: djzim23
Reviews.Content: First off let me say that I have a few TVs near me to compare this to...my parents have a 37" Westinghouse LCD (720p) and my brother has a 50" Samsung plasma (720p).  My TV was delivered using CEVA.  Over the phone they gave a 4 hour time block (10am-2pm) and said the driver would call when he was 30 minutes away.  At 2:30pm I called, and found out he got slowed down at his last delivery.  He was at my apartment by 3:30pm.NOTE:  I was told to sign that he would not unpack it and when I questioned this he dodged the question.  Not a big deal, but 90% of the population probably cannot get the TV out of the box as I did by themselvesInputs>>>Comcast digital cable set top box (STB) connected with Belkin component cables.  I did this for two-fold.  1) My current box does not have HDMI out and I would rather not pay for it.  2)  Unless someone corrects me, I do not believe HDTV channels are 1080p, they are only 720p; therefore component is all that is needed.  **my audio reciever does not have HDMI**PS3 connected with Cables Unlimited HDMI (1.3) cable.  I used HDMI because PS3 games and Blu-Ray both can output at 1080p.  I send the video signal along the HDMI and audio to the Multi-AV with an old PS3 component Video and audio cable to my receiver.  My receiver is nothing special, but it unfortunately does not have an optical input, so I am left to use RCA cables.Note about Cables:  I used Belkin PureAV component video and Belkin PureAV RCA audio cables.  They can be found in the $8 to $15 range.  I have a Cables Unlimited HDMI cable that was around $10.  In hindsight I would have opted for something that Belkin made.  Do not waste your money on $80-100 Monster cables however.TV>>>The picture is wonderful, I played with the settings.  120Hz AutoMotion can make things look "Soap Opera"-ish.  I kept adjusting it while watching "The Office" TNT-HD last night.  When I was watching Sportscenter with lots of NFL highlighs I kept 120Hz AutoMotion running on High.  I also adjusted the NR (Noise Reduction) to High as well.  I was able to see noise in dark areas of the screen, but adjusting this eliminated this problem.  All system settings seemed good for PS3.  I played Tiger Woods 09 last night and it was very sharp.  I plan on watching "Shooter" BD tonight so I will see how deep black responds in a dark room.Comparison>>><<<The Westinghouse cannot match this.  The "W" is approximately 4 years old and LCD has come a long way.  If you are of the crowd, "plasma is better than LCD", "Plasma is sharper", etc. then you need to go to BB and do some comparing.<<<The Samsung plasma is similar.  If you recently purchased a plasma hold onto it.  Or move it to another room in the house and get a new LCD.  I am hoping to do side-by-side with my TV and the plasma to compare picture quality, contrast ratio, etc.  Plasma's are very hard to move becaue the front panel is glass and if it cracks your TV is done.  Not so with the LCD, it is not really different from the screen on your cell phone, Nintendo DS, old Gameboy, etc.I rate the Samsung LN46A650 at 93% or A-.  For the value I give it about a 97%.  It isn't cheap, but definitely not the most expensive.  I did look/shop around with Sony as well and I can say that the XBRs are a nicer unit.  But they are in the neighborhood of DOUBLE what I paid.  And for the ultimate TV, BB had the LN46A650 sitting next to a Pioneer Kuro for comparison.  Samsung held its own, but the Kuro is unreal.Hopefully I was able to help some of you technology challenged individuals.  If you know about TVs, sorry I didn't want to bore the masses =)

Reviews.Title: W O W ! ! !
Reviews.Author: Jeramiah L. Olson
Reviews.Content: I thought I had an HDTV, but my old one was junk compared to this one.  First of all, the delivery went great, in and out in about four minutes, unboxed everything and even set it on top of my console.  I was initially a little upset because I didn't see an input for an HDTV antenna like there is on my old set, but after autoprograming I found out there must be an antenna system in the set because all of the channels came in and actually came in clearer than with the antenna.I'm blown away by how great everything looks.  Wow sums it up.  Things look better than perfect and I haven't even messed around with any of the settings yet.I don't have a blu-ray DVD player yet, just a Sony upscaler, but wow to that, too.  I just put in Transformers and am completely stunned with how great it looks.  Can't wait to get the blu-ray or PS3 in a few months.The Touch of Color doesn't show up when the lights are off, sort of just blends in most of the time anyway.Buy it.  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46' LCD TV 650
Reviews.Author: Stephen Pruitt
Reviews.Content: Love the TV! Love Amazon! Less than impressed with Samsung! Had a sound problem with first TV which Samsung said they would send firmware to repair. Called back a week later asking where firmware was and they couldn't even verify it had been shipped. Called Amazon told them the problem and they immediately shipped a replacement TV. Still have seen no firmware!!! Luckily no longer need.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: person
Reviews.Content: Overall great TV for the price.  Shipping was a breeze.  Keep in mind though that this TV DOES have glare.  Quite a bit.  It just like a normal CRT TV.  If you have direct sun light you will see the reflection.  The TV has a nice swivel stand, so during the day you can tilt the TV to avoid the glare.  The trade off of course is that the picture is really good.If you don't want glare than go with sony's W series.  Its a few hundred dollors more with similar features except 10 bit color (which you won't notice.  Don't believe the marketing hype on that feature.).

Reviews.Title: Super nice Samsung set.
Reviews.Author: Richard E. Faldasz
Reviews.Content: Having had this tv for several months now, I have to say we are very pleased with it. For the high def channels carried by our cable company, the ones that have their act together and broadcast a good signal come out amazing on this tv. Having watched hd channels for a while now it really is true what others say, not all hd sources are created the same.The touch of color on this set is hardly noticeable. So if your worried about that feature clashing with your decor don't worry about it.We also have not seen the power down issues reported in other reviews. Must have been something isolated to earlier models. When we received the tv, there was a sticker on the box that made note of the tv having a firmware upgrade. So the power down issue was probably addressed by that.The remote is fine. As others have noted the scroll wheel on the remote doesn't react quickly so it can be a bit frustrating. But there are other keys on the remote that perform the same functions.Plus after buying the TV from Amazon the price dropped twice within 30 days of purchase. A quick call to Amazon Customer Service and I was refunded the difference. So it pays to keep an eye on the price after purchase, at least for 30 days while the price guarantee is in effect.All in all a good choice for your money!

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted and delivered right on time!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Lantz
Reviews.Content: I priced shopped all the brick and mortar stores in my area and none came even close to Amazon's price.  My only fear was the delivery, and it turned out just as promised! One week after I ordered the TV they brought it to my door, uncrated it and tested the power and sound and were gone!  The picture quality is superb and I love the swivel feature of the 650 model over the 750.  Don't hesitate to buy this one and get it from Amazon to save big bucks!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: C. Trainer
Reviews.Content: Awesome set, bought for $1780 or so but then it lowered to $1669 called amazon and got refunded the difference. Excellent! Red is not distracting and now I have a great home cinema for well under $2000. Great deal dont worry this is a great product.

Reviews.Title: HAPPY IN LAS VEGAS  Best TV I have ever seen!
Reviews.Author: E. Lindsley
Reviews.Content: I was super reluctant to even consider such a large purchase of electronics on-line.  What a surprise!! The TV is absolutely the best I have ever seen.  Flawless in every respect. It arrived 6 days before it was promised and the delivery was superb.  Fast, courteous,and professional in all all aspects. My reluctance to use Amazon was certainly unfounded.  Great transaction all the way.

Reviews.Title: INSANE picture
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I've been waiting for years for the right technology & price.  I had to pull the trigger as the Olympics are here.  I'm so glad I did.  It's like having a front row seat at the events.  If I could hold off for another year or 2 I would have as there will be newer technology coming out soon.  However, I could not stand having a large built in entertainment center with a small 27" tube tv anymore.  I figure I'll just move this tv to another room, and buy a newer tv for the entertainment room when the time comes.  The picture is insane!  For me, I'm willing to deal with the glare issue.  I simply keep the windows in front of the tv covered, and adjust the back lighting.  At night there's no problem at all.  A non issue for me.  The advantage of this glossy screen is a sharper/deeper picture.  I much prefer this screen over a matte screen.  Matte just doesn't do it for me.  Otherwise, everything else is fantastic or minor issues.  If you must buy a tv now, THIS IS THE ONE TO BUY!

Reviews.Title: Great deal, great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: TN VOL
Reviews.Content: After much research, we purchased this TV and have been thrilled with its appearance, performance, and price. We did extensive research online and in multiple stores before selecting this LCD TV. I was actually between this LCD and a 50" Samsung Plasma but decided this one to be the better solution for our needs. We were leary of purchasing it online, but we couldn't be happier with our decision.Our family room is in a medium-lit room with a fair amount of light. Yet, the glare issue hasn't been that noticeable during the day. Viewing angle is great as we have seats off to the side of the screen as well. At night, the colors and deep blacks are phenomenal as well. Definitely can tell the difference between standard cable and HD quality feeds, but this is common to all HD sets I've seen. Still, the standard cable feed isn't that bad. The 120Hz processor does well too and provided remarkable clarity when we watched Pirates of the Caribean 3 last week. Finally, the speakers and the XTSurround capability delivered quality audio until we hooked it up to our home theater system.Amazon had the best price and with free shipping, I still haven't seen a sales ad for this TV within $300 of what we paid for it (before taxes). The white glove delivery was professional and quick. The installer even went above and beyond to make sure the cable feed worked. Excellent quality service!Watching the Olympics has been awesome with this TV! Samsung and Amazon delivered for us and I highly recommend both!

Reviews.Title: 46 inches is plenty!!!
Reviews.Author: Tim Jones "Tim"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the LN46A650 and have loved it since. I am actually using my T.V. as a monitor to write this. I originally planned to buy the 52 inch 650 series until I came across a salesman who showed me just how big it would be in my room, which is  a pretty big room. So instead I chose the 46 inch and it fits perfectly. The television works great with blueray on my Playstation 3 and the HD box is also decent with the T.V..It takes about 30 minutes to take everything out of the box and hook it up. You will also have to register your television online at Samsung.com if you want to use the limited lifetime warranty. I have had no problems with the T.V. since I have owned it. It has not shut off, overheated, the screen works great and I couldn't be happier.All in all, it's a great buy and you won't be dissapointed. I also have the Samsung 5.1 surround sound coming from Amazon to go with my system. Its called the HT-Z310T and has about 1,000 watts worth of power.The T.V. is also easy to configure when you finally get it set up.

Reviews.Title: I'll never get a TV another way
Reviews.Author: David L. Arivett
Reviews.Content: After a couple of weeks trying to muddle through various magazine and technical article comparisons, someone mentioned I should check out Amazon. I was skeptical about making such a large purchase without face-to-face interaction. After reading the many reviews from actual consumers I purchased this one. The TV is fantastic and I don't get any of the disturbing "blur" during HD telecasts of sporting events. The delivery and set-up were quick and professional. Two technicians arrived at the door on time with box in hand. The TV and accessories were set-up and tested and all boxes removed within 10 minutes of their arrival. I'll never buy a TV another way. Oh, by the way I saved $400 over the Big Box prices!

Reviews.Title: Very Happy Customer
Reviews.Author: Andrew Rumble
Reviews.Content: I was, like most of you, searching for one of the best televisions available but not wanting to spend 3,000-4,000 dollars on a Pioneer plasma. I'm currently a college student so it took me a long time just to save up for the 650. And after around a year of researching, I really could not be happier. Batman Begins and Planet Earth on Blu-ray just make you want to reach through the screen at some points (the tumbler car chase scene is simply ridiculous and is what I first show off to my friends). I used to have an issue with the auto motion plus but since you can set it to off, low, medium, or high, it gives you a chance to gradually get used to it. I have a PS3 and GTA IV and Modern Warfare are really something to experience especially when set to the very bright game mode. The delivery was great and they had everything set up extremely quick. I even got $82 back with the 30 day price match. Just take my advice and see for yourself at Best Buy. You can then laugh at their listed price, go home, read the glowing reviews, and buy this tv from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Everything I Expected
Reviews.Author: Go Cubs Go
Reviews.Content: Researched for almost a year.  I have a Panasonic ED Plasma from three years ago....that I paid 2300 for.  I just wanted to upgrade to 1080, better pic etc.  It came down to this and Panasonic TH-42PZ85U.  Last minute measuring of my entertainment center made the choice easier as the panaconic was about 1" too big.  HDMI picture is awesome.  Sound from the TV is even pretty good.  Better through DTS but pretty good.  Amazon service was very good.  A little fuzzy on some regular def channels, but I rarely watch those.  Sooner or later those will turn to Hi def anyway.Pic in Pic....is there a swap function?  I don't think there is.  If so, can someone please advise?  I can't figure it out.Also...is there an on/off switch on the TV itself?  Please advise if there is.  Can't find that either.People complain about the remote....It is fine....I think people just need something to complain about.  Now that I have all the settings done, I just use the Comcast remote anywayVery happy.  The red is no big deal either.  I actually think it looks kind of cool.

Reviews.Title: Delivery was Excellent!!!
Reviews.Author: Mini Cooper "Mini Cooper"
Reviews.Content: I was so very impressed with my delivery today of my 46" Samsung TV  by CEVA that I wanted to let others know that it works. The set was in its original packaging (which I have saved) by two guys who knew what they were doing. It was a "white glove" delivery all the way. Buying on-line saved me $500 and included free shipping. If I had purchased this TV from a "brick & mortar" store such as Sears it would have cost me an additional $65.00 for delivery. Delivery was expedient with the set arriving within a 2-day period of time. I checked the software update as per the directions from the Amazon discussions and found that my set has updated software. As soon as I have it cable-ready I will write another review. By the way, I also purchased the Logitech Harmony 520 remote control as per the Amazon discussion group and I found it easy to program and have ready for my TV and DVD player. Life is good!!! Amazon can be proud of the services I have gotten use to. A " brick& mortar" store could not have done any better on the service.  Service was A+.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!  Great Price!
Reviews.Author: SS
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my parents and they love it.  The 650 series Samsung has all the great features you could want in a TV and Amazon had a great deal on the price.The picture quality is crystal clear even in a well lit room and the 4 HDMI ports ensure that all our equipment is hooked up with the highest possible data integrity.  The 120Hz refresh rate vs 60Hz may not sound that impressive, but the visual difference is astounding.  Since I bought it, I have already recommended this TV and other TVs in the Samsung 650 series to friends and coworkers.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: Anthony Riggs "Fish2Much"
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic HDTV. I spent many weeks pouring over reviews and going to the local electronics store before settling on this unit. The picture is GREAT and the sound is very good as well. It has lots of features and options that the general user will not need but for the money this is a super set.  I have a Toshiba 56" DLP that doesn't have the 1080P or the 120Hz and although it is a nice set it doesn't compare to the Samsung. On sports with the 120Hz is were I can tell a big difference as the Toshiba has a trailing effect to a lot of the fast motion were the Samsung doesn't.My recommendation--- if your looking for a 46inch top of the line LCD HDTV for a good price then this is it.

Reviews.Title: 46A650 from Amazon:  A great set, a great price
Reviews.Author: R. Benson
Reviews.Content: The LN-46A650 is a great HDTV.  CNET's review of the 52" version applies across the board here.  HD images are vivid, clear and crisp with fantastic detail, and dark areas very rich and detailed.  And when I turn on the noise reduction, even our old VHS player looks decent!  No worries over the red "touch of color", it's hardly noticeable.  Even after hours of running, there's no sign of the shut-down problem reported by others.  The remote's a little funky, but once you learn it, it's fine.One thing to do right away: turn down the backlight, it ships very bright, and you'll get better images with a dimmer setting.  I went with CNET's dark-room settings, but AVS forums also have good suggestions.Biggest drawback: the deep blacks can combine with a somewhat reflective screen to reflect bright light sources behind the viewer.  It's no worse than our old CRT SDTV, but the flat-screen makes the reflection "more perfect" and hence more noticeable.  But it's only at night, with fluorescent lights glaring from a room behind the viewer, that it can be seen.  Dim or put out those lights (eg in daytime) or change the angle of the TV (swivel stand is included), and all's well.  And of course, it's only seen where the screen is very dark - so most of the time, reflections are not visible.The 120Hz?  Effective in very fast motion, and it can be tailored somewhat.  And frankly, the only time I can really see a difference is with very fast objects, as in tennis or baseball - otherwise, the fast 4ms refresh makes for fairly blur-free viewing even with 120Hz turned off.Delivery: I ordered it from Amazon with free shipping, and got it in about a week and a half, with outstanding service from shipper CEVA - the delivery guy called to arrange delivery time, unpacked it, set it up, even hooked up our cable and tested the set out, and was polite and professional.Price: After checking prices for months prior to purchase, I can say that Amazon's pricing beats anybody else that I would trust (and has a 30-day return policy).  After purchase, I checked the price regularly and used the 30-day price guarantee (1-800-201-7575, ext 7) to get another $200 off my purchase price.I'm very happy with my purchase and everyone who's seen it has been impressed.  Thanks to Samsung, for making the nicest TV I've ever owned, and to Amazon, for making it affordable!

Reviews.Title: UNBELIEVABLE!!
Reviews.Author: David J. Shoemaker
Reviews.Content: We received our SAMSUNG LN46A650 in perfect condition.  CEVA did a great job of providing quality delivery to include taking it out of the box and setting it up for you.  The TV itself--all I can say is WOW!  I did about 4 months worth of research before I bought this TV.  I went to BEST BUY to see the TV, and two different salesman at different times told me that SAMSUNG has LCD figured out and that this TV is the best on the market.  I came home, looked it up on AMAZON and found it to be $700 cheaper!We hooked up our DVD player and the Nintendo Game Cube to it.  The TV provided unbelievable picture from those sources.  The Olympics and NFL are around the corner--this TV is a must have!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A650 Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: F. Guasto
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be anymore pleased with the Samsung LCD 46 inch Model LN46A650 television I recently purchased. For the money it's a great buy & the picture has better quality than I've seen on much more expensive sets. The colors are so vivid & the picture is so sharp, & clear, that it's amazing.  Also with the set having 120Hz, rather than the usual 60Hz,the picture stays sharp no matter how fast movements on the screen are. For the price it's a terrific set & you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Great way to buy a TV
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: I decided to purchase the Samsung LN46A650 after reading numerous reviews. I checked prices at the major electronics stores around, and none were even close to the Amazon price (or should I say "prices," as the price changes frequently).  One thing I liked about the process is that I didn't have to put up with the hard sell about an extended warranty or other add-ons. I ordered the unit on a Sunday, and got it on Thursday, six days earlier than the predicted delivery date.  The box was delivered on time (based on the 1-day call ahead), brought inside and placed right where we wanted.  It's pretty easy to remove the unit from the box, or actually, the box from the unit, and the unit is already mounted on its stand.  Took about ten minutes to connect everything and turn it on. I'm not a geek, so I'll let others provide a technical review, and I've read many posts about set up and configuration, but it to my untrained eye, it worked fine straight out of the box. What more can you ask?

Reviews.Title: Over 15 months of research, and I found the PERFECT TV!!
Reviews.Author: T. McIntosh "travmac"
Reviews.Content: I'm the type of person that does research for items that cost $100, so you can imagine the depth of research that I did for $2500+ LCD TV. I began looking at last years Samsung, the 71 Series. This is coming from a Die Hard Sony family, we have had Sony LCD's for years and no problems what so ever with them. I was set on getting the Sony 46" XBR4 or 46" XBR5, but after seeing the XBR4 in person I was not impressed,( I know that Best Buy just turns the TV's on and thats it) but regardless the XBR was being outperformed by the V series Sony. At this point I was very frustrated because every TV that I liked had a dead end. I then noticed this Samsung LN46A650, The clarity and sharpness of this LCD was literally astounding. Well it was only 3 weeks after this moment that I had the 46" 6 Series in my room on my Floating Stand. While I am writing this review, Pirates of the Caribbean is playing (Blu Ray), and honestly the picture is Remarkable. I have taken so long to write this review because I keep watching the Super Sharp picture of the Samsung. Anyway, I wanted to buy it from Best Buy but they could not get close to Amazon's price, their lowest price was $2100 then $300 for a 4 year warranty, also $200 tax so $2600. Amazon's price was $2149 for the TV and the 5 year Warranty, NO TAX!!, FREE SHIPPING!!That Being Said, the Pros of the LN46A650,- Super Clear Panel. 120Hz, 50,000-1 Contrast Ratio. (HDMI with) Blu Ray, PS3, Xbox, HD channels or anything in Full HD will amaze even the Biggest Sony Fan (take my word for it).- 4 HDMI 1.3 ports, Digital Audio out, High Speed LCD, 4ms Response time.- TV is very light, easily mounts on stand or wall.- Touch of Color (ToC), is very subtle but adds style to any room.- Regular satellite looks good, use S-Video for Sat. instead of AV cables.- Also Amazon shipped it within a week, and also the price dropped and I recieved a refund for the difference in the price.The Cons of this TV,- Has a slight glare on the screen, but my window is directly across from the TV.- Thats it.Basically the TV is beyond clear, I have watched a 720p, and 1080p Sony for 3-4 years and my new Samsung blows it out of the water. If you are at all apprehensive about purchasing this TV online then don't be. 1080p looks astounding, and a very reasonable price for the Product.A++ to Samsung and Amazon, Thanks to Samsung for the Amazing TV and to Amazon for the remarkable price.I hope this helps someone who is on the fence of which TV to buy. Also I'm using a PS3 as a Blu Ray player and It works Perfect, it matches the TV, and is very quiet. Plain and simple this TV does a perfect job and at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME PICTURE, GREAT VALUE FOR THE MONEY
Reviews.Author: Doug Miller "WHIZZERDOG"
Reviews.Content: ORDERED THIS SET ON A SATURDAY AND RECEIVED IT ON A TUESDAY, GREAT DELIVERY TIME FRAME. THE PICTURE IS AWSOME AND ALL THE FEATURES ARE VERY EASY TO USE AFTER A LITTLE PRACTICE. I THOUGHT LIVE BROADCASTS WERE GOING TO BE REALISTIC, BUT LET ME TELL YOU, THE OTHER PROGRAMING IS JUST AS GOOD IN HD. REGULAR BRODCASTING IS ALSO GOOD, BETTER THAN ALOT OF OTHER MODELS FROM COMPETITORS. BROUGHT AT ONE PRICE A WEEK LATER PRICE WAS REDUCED, E-MAILED AMAZON CUSTOMER SERVICE AND GOT A PRICE REDUCTION REFUND, CAN'T GO WRONG WITH AMAZON.COM. IT'S PICTURE IS AS GOOD AS SONY'S XBR SERIES, YOU CAN NOT GO WRONG WITH THIS HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV...Excellent  Service
Reviews.Author: MTeer
Reviews.Content: Received my Samsung 46" HDTV from Amazon.  I confess I have never spent that much money over the internet.  I was a little apprehensive to order something of that much value, but saving $500 with Amazon over Circuit City or Best Buy convinced me to buy from Amazon.  For those that may be a little fearful, don't worry.  My experience was great.  I ordered the TV on Tuesday and it was delievered on Friday, talk about fast shipping.  Plus, the shipping was FREE, and I paid no tax.  I am in the prcess of buying another HDTV for my bedroom.  I'll have no problem ordering from Amazon.  I highly recommend the Samusng TV as well.  Great picture & sound.  I had been comparing TV's for about 3 months.  Could not have bought a better choice.

Reviews.Title: Best picture I've seen on any set.
Reviews.Author: John C. Peters
Reviews.Content: I have had this set now for about 4 weeks and am completely thrilled with it.  I have not seen a better picture on any other set.  The picture image is virtually unchanged even when off to an extreme (>120 degrees) viewing angle.  The reflectivity of the screen is not a problem where it used to be with a tube TV in the same location.  I really have no complaints about it at all.  The price at Amazon was hundreds better than anywhere else and the delivery was well before the date initially quoted. I did not even have the trouble with the remote that some others complained about.  The center wheel can be spun or just touched on any axis to move that direction.  No shut off problem at all either.  Blue Ray discs are very lifelike.  DirecTV HD also looks great on it.  I watched some of the French Open tennis and felt like I was in the stands, not watching it on TV.  When you view standard def TV signals you can really see the differnece in quality but that is not the fault of the TV.  The sound is not bad but it has all the connectors necessary to hook it up to a better sound system.

Reviews.Title: samsung ln46a650  120hz tv
Reviews.Author: Joseph R. Forys
Reviews.Content: great tv value for the price-one of the best.  well pleased with amazon price,white glove delivery,and prompt,courteous,outstanding customer service. definitely plan to make future purchases from amazon.

Reviews.Title: Our first big screen
Reviews.Author: OMG PWNIES "OMG PWNIES"
Reviews.Content: No complaints. The TV looks awesome. Delivery was timely and the delivery company was spot on.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LCD at an Excellent price!
Reviews.Author: Bud "Bud"
Reviews.Content: I have been totally satisified with the buying experience with Amazon on this purchase.  The delivery went flawlessly and the TV is excellent.  We have the TV in our main room with a cathedral ceiling next to a large set of North facing windows and the picture quality is great.  The blacks are deep and dark the XBox 360 games are incredible on this unit.  I am actually going to order it's bigger brother the LN52A650 for our downstairs family room.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected
Reviews.Author: Dino Chiesa
Reviews.Content: The TV is excellent.  The HD display really makes a difference on movies and sporting events - even comparing to 720i or 1080i TVs from a year or two ago.  My kids absolutely LOVE watching movies on this set - regular DVDs look great, and bluray discs look fantastic.  This is hands-down the best view I have ever seen.  It makes TV-viewing a real pleasure.Ordering such a big thing from Amazon was a little scary, but the set arrived in 4 days, no problems. The delivery people were speedy, pleasant, helpful, and clean. They called ahead of time to let me know they were coming.  They cam faster than they said they would. They brought it in, set it up, tested it. It was better - much better - than buying from a store and carrying it home myself.And the price was Excellent.I would definitely buy this again!

Reviews.Title: great tv, so so delivery
Reviews.Author: Denver dan "dan"
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding TV.  The newest download from Samsung takes care of the earlier problems, i.e. random shutoff, purple haze, flashlight, etc. [...]  It took three weeks to get this TV.  CEVA claimed they didn't have my phone number on the order,  Amazon claims it was on the order.  A bit of finger pointing led to confusion & a dissapointingly long delivery.  CEVA couldn't deliver on weekends in my Denver suburb area & said they needed 2 drivers to bring in the TV.  When they finally showed up 1 driver brought it in on a 2 wheeler & unwrapped it & put it on my stand.  All in all the delivery was slow but ok when it finally arrived.  I recommend this tv, especially with the falling Amazon prices.  Check back frequently for price decreases & call for a credit.

Reviews.Title: The Best LCD TV in 2008
Reviews.Author: Vinay S. Bhamidipati
Reviews.Content: I just love this TV. It doesn't matter what show is on HD, but the colors are vibrant and the 50,000:1 contrast ration really shows. Golly, the 120Hz frame refresh feature makes people look real and the flow is really smooth. I am just waiting for the NFL season to start to watch the games in HD. The remote however is still sucks, but I corrected my problem by getting a universal remote.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture Beautiful Design
Reviews.Author: Richard Ciordia "mobilemuzicman"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent Picture. Great DesignCons: "Touchy" remote wheelDelivery was right on time as they set up the TV and tested it before they left.The box had a sticker telling me that a software upgrade had been added to the set most likely eliminating the shutdown issues that some reviewers claimed.I had concerns about buying this set as I have 2 windows that are 4' x 6' and are south facing. The 42" tabletop projection Sony I had had terrible glare and some reviewers claimed this was an issue. Well to me it wasn't. The high contrast ratio obliterated daylight and unless I viewed from the side it is not an issue.My wife also was very concerned that the red would look garish. The photos don't do it justice. It fits into our room even better than I thought it would. The color is subdued and not noticeable at all when it's on. When it's off it looks modern, clean and classy.I have basic cable from Brighthouse and thought I would not get any HD channels. Wrong! I currently have about 15 HD channels that look terrific even though they are 750P and 1080i. Also many sub channels that I never had with an analog Sony TV.Currently only have a progressive 480p DVD player/burner but the picture is far better than it was with the Sony. I am looking to upgrade to an upconverting DVD player and eventually Blu-Ray but can't seem to justify the cost of the player and discs yet when the current picture is so nice.Wii games are great even though these too are not HD.My photos taken on my Nikon 10MP Digital Camera are awesome looking using the "wiselink" USB port. Haven't tried video through a memory card yet.Still trying to get used to the proper screen formats that are available.Depending on the channel widescreen degrades the picture changing it from the original 4:3 format. Sometimes there are "letterbox" bars on the top or on the sides. This is due to the different formats currently being broadcast from the different stations and in no way reflect on the TV itself. Still though you need to mess with it if you don't like what you see.Dynamic mode seems to give me the best overall picture although there are several settings to choose from including a custom setting.I also like the fact there is volume levelling virtually eliminating the often louder audio when a show breaks to commercial. You have to turn this feature on.The picture blows away my recent Visio 32" TV that I purchased for the bedroom, but admittedly, that TV was $499 and still way ahead of any analog TV out there.Now I just need a HD DVR that I can buy and not rent from the Tivo,cable or sat folks. Looks like someone has a monopoly. ;-0

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: FamilyManOnBudget
Reviews.Content: We have had our tv not quite a week and I am VERY happy with my choice. The picture , when coupled with high quality sources is amazing and much better than most HD tv's I've seen. what I did not expect was it to do as well with a cheap DVD progressive scan/component video player that does not upscale. It looks hi def to me (for the most part) and I am a techie person. For the person that mentioned it only has one composite on the side, the first component video in the rear can double as composite (just read the manual). The remote is ok, not too bad . I really don't have too much negative to say other than the typical issues with HDTV's which is really just an issue with low res sources and the HDMI negotiation that occurs on a HD compatible cable box with multiple stations at multiple outputs. Things I have yet to try out-USB connections to play music/view images-Ethernet jack for the built in web connections-'adjusting' HDTV calibration other than with a few settings for 'cinema' mode black settings. The set does ask if you are setting it up for a store or home unit and it doesn't look to garish for the most part.-anylink setup for controlling other HDMI connections.One thing that made me really happy was getting the HD cable box since watching cable is what we normally do. What's really cool is watching sports or other 'live' HD events or any of the high resolution shows/channels , it will put a smile on your face with the quality. An unrelated side effect is that you now want all your other items to work as well as this one. I think a new home theater receiver is NEXT !!

Reviews.Title: THE GREATEST FREAKIN TV EVER!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Soeung "RST"
Reviews.Content: I pretty much never write reviews for anything but for this product I have to. I use to have a Sony 32" 720p LCD TV and after upgrading to this Samsung 46" made every movie I watched, every game I played look even more amazing than any other HDTV I've seen at stores, friends house, or wherever. If your looking for a really good TV get this one. The 120hz frame rate makes the picture look even more amazing than anything you've seen before.Trust me, this TV is worth every cent.Also FYI, my TV is one of those that shuts off on its own, but after I installed the firmware update, it never happen again.[...]Please don't let a little glitch like this turn you away from this TV. This is the best of the best of HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Wait for pre-Thanksgiving price and offer
Reviews.Author: LLH
Reviews.Content: The day before Thanksgiving this TV was $1514, with a free blueray player and 24-month financing.  Amazon since cranked up the price by $100 and withdrew their free blueray player offer.  I hope everyone waits and forces them to match their pre-Thanksgiving offer again.  They are trying to take advantage of folks who must have the TV by Xmas.

Reviews.Title: Samsung quality customer care service
Reviews.Author: R. Adams
Reviews.Content: Our years out-of-warranty 46 inch LCD Samsung tv died this past weekend, so I figured I was going to be in the market for a new tv. Looking at the prices and reviews, I decided to the Samsung service number on my warranty card to see if they might at least be willing to recommend someone in our area who repaired their products. Instead, the service rep asked me for the model and serial numbers, and then asked me what was wrong, so I told him the symptoms of how it died. He said that it might be covered under warranty. I pointed out again that the warranty had long expired. He said nonetheless a few things were still covered and for free they would have a technician see if my situation was and if so, repair it  for free. 2 hours later a technician was at our house and an hour after the tv was back on its mount, working like new. Charge to me? Zero.When I read all the unhappy reports on other company's non-service, Samsung's excellent treatment deserves to be pointed out. Thank you, Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Not reliable
Reviews.Author: Ian B Chodos
Reviews.Content: The TV was great for 4 years. No complaints... until this past week when it broke. Started turning on and off spontaneously, plus the picture disappears and is replaced by colored vertical lines.  Samsung is not covering the $300 repair expense to replace the "Main Board". I'm really disappointed by Samsung and it's highly unlikely I'll purchase one of their products again.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Patricia Bodnar
Reviews.Content: I wish that I had investigated Samsung's countless customer services issues and known of problems with the panel of this television before I made my purchase.As with many other customers, the panel of this television became defective far too soon.  We would be more than happy to pay labor costs to have the defective part replaced, but Samsung representatives are unwilling to do anything to correct the situation.Buyer beware.  Do your research and read some of the hundreds of complaints made against products from this company and their customer service department.We are out $2.000 and they could care less.

Reviews.Title: All fun and games until...
Reviews.Author: Erin J Brennan
Reviews.Content: 3 years later when the color/picture goes and nobody wants to help you. 10,000 hours or whatever the guarantee is a joke (anybody see Tommy Boy?). Bottom line: warranty expires after a year - then it's every man for himself. Will NEVER buy a Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: I would avoid
Reviews.Author: TheBeagle
Reviews.Content: I would not buy a Samsung LCD TV. Mine worked beautifully until after the warranty expired (> 1 yr) and then the problemsstarted. Web searches show many many people with similar issues. Mostly, it seems that the power supply/capacitors faileasily (cheap components). My problem is different as there is no clicking sound when my TV screen goes black, which it doesseveral times a session. Tapping the back (or recycling the power) brings back the picture (contact somehwere?) but only temporarily.Once the set has been on some time, it seems to work OK. Shame as it is a fine TV otherwise. Research indicates that it is better tobuy a new (non-Samsung) TV rather than pay $500-900 for replacement parts that will probably fail again. Anyone else have this issue?$1600 for a disposable TV set. Nice one ! Anyone else believe that bulk buyers like Amazon get inferior-grade versions of the sameproduct?

Reviews.Title: Great for a while
Reviews.Author: Lisa Suter
Reviews.Content: Bought in June of 08 loved it until recently when it started having problems coming on. First it took a minute now days later it takes 15 minutes to come on. According to the Internet this is a very common problem and soon mine will not come on at all. You need to replace the Power supply and possible Mother board and that's big money. So no more Samsung for me. Sony here I come.

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: GPD
Reviews.Content: After about 18 months during which the TV worked perfectly, the on/off switch stopped working. Knowing that my one year warranty had expired, I expected to have to call in a repair technician. Prior to doing this, I decided to call Samsung to see if they had any insight to what the problem might be. Without having to go through interminable menus I was able to speak with a knowledgable customer service representative right away (right here in America) who was quickly able to identify the probable cause of my problem as a failed capacitor. Apparently other customers had had similar problems.The customer service representative offered to have one of their technicians come to my home and replace the capacitor at no cost to myself. The technician arrived as scheduled and fixed the problem immediately.I write this because I have seen some negative reviews about Samsung's customer service: one review even mentioned the same capacitor issue and stated that Samsung would do nothing about it. My experience was quite the opposite. Inasmuch as my warranty expired I was expecting to have to pay for the repair; but because Samsung realized that the problem was not mine alone they offered to repair it for free. The whole thing was handled very professionally from beginning to end. I rate the TV four stars instead of five only because of the capacitor issue.

Reviews.Title: Best. HDTV. Ever.
Reviews.Author: Brian Lacy "creatorbri"
Reviews.Content: Oh. Wow. I have had this TV for six months now. I originally purchased a Samsung 52-inch A550, but it was too big and it stuttered playing Blu-ray movies due to the 60hz refresh rate. So I traded it for the A650.Every time I turn it on, its like being transported to another reality. Seriously, the color depth, the clarity, the contrast -- everything on this TV is pretty much, well, perfect. It is loaded with features, including this auto-smoothing effect that makes standard 24- or 30-fps content feel like its playing at 120fps, and it causes a really eerie, all-too-lifelike effect, like the TV isn't a TV, its a Window, and all the action is literally taking place in front of your face. I leave this feature turned off, its just too intense for me.I've never had a technical problem with the TV. Its super easy to operate, the menus are friendly, and the "Red Touch of Color" -- which at first I worried would bother me -- adds just the subtlest hint of elegance. You barely notice it unless there's light from behind, and then its actually kind of cool looking.I can't say enough good about this product, but I don't want to talk your ear off -- I will just say this: If you are thinking about purchasing ANY HDTV in this price- and/or size-range, you'd be doing yourself a favor to take a good hard look at the Samsung 46-inch A650.

Reviews.Title: Great picture before display/picture stopped working.
Reviews.Author: Marc W. Keepper "Marcola"
Reviews.Content: The SAMSUNG LN46A6501F worked great until it stopped working.I purchased this exact LCD TV from Amazon and 4 months in, but (as of yesterday) there is never any picture (and the firmware was up to date) and now the TV turns itself on and off intermittently.If there's never any picture then I cannot see any menus to try and troubleshoot. From other user boards, this appears to be a common issue for Samsung LCD's. Looks like I have to have the entire main board replaced. Am in process with Samsung on that. I am writing now as this appears to be a common issue within the first 4-6 months of the SAMSUNG LN 6 Series.The other reason for the 3 stars is that Samsung's user documentation would be improved by adding a one-sheet with the standard set up info. If Apple can do this, why can't other vendors?-----Update: The manufacturer sent a contractor out & he replaced parts for free as part of the warranty. The TV has worked well ever since.

Reviews.Title: Another great Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: B. Smith "Cybercowboy"
Reviews.Content: I have two Samsung TV's (a 61" DLP and a 27" LCD for the kitchen) and ordered this TV for a friend as he didn't have an Amazon account and isn't computer savvy. I then set it up for him using some default settings I gleaned from the great avsforums.com website.All I can say is, wow, this is just a great TV. I can't imagine a LCD TV looking any better. The TV was delivered to my house and arrived in perfect condition and several days ahead of schedule. The shipping company contacted me several hours prior to delivery, couldn't have gone better in that respect.I also know a couple of other friends who have this same TV and they love it too. I'm going to be getting one for my bedroom in a few months, when we're done with a kitchen/master BR/master bath remodel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding in just about all aspects
Reviews.Author: G. Rohde
Reviews.Content: I purchased the LN46A650 in December 08 and it is my first flat panel television.  I currently have an aging Pioneer Elite RPTV in the den/home theater so this Samsung is for the kitchen/family room.Delivery: Overall delivery was very good and set up was ok, although the delivery man told my wife he could not connect it to our cable (Fios HD), only to an antenna.  Since I don't have an antenna he turned it on to static and was then satisfied it was working and left.Initial Impression: When I got home and connected it to the Fios box with HDMI my wife's first words were that it just looks so much more high def than our Pioneer HDTV and I agreed.Physical: I was initially very worried about the red touch of color, but it really is barely noticeable unless there is a back light or a lot of light in the room.  The TV is not too heavy and overall has a very attractive sleek look. It does collect dust on the bezel and stand especially, so dust often.Interface/Controls: The menu system looks very nice and there are an extensive set of controls, but the response could be faster.  The remote control has an innovative scroll wheel, but the response is too slow to make it practical. There are also some controls that would be very nice to have quick access to, such as the AMP function and backlight. Ideally you should be able to save different custom settings and then toggle between them such as for daytime, low light, or sports. You can switch between Dynamic, Standard and Movie, but since only Movie lets you get accurate calibration, it's not as useful as letting you save any custom settings as a preset. The TV is slow to start up and lock onto the HDMI signal - not really a big deal.Performance: I adjusted the TV using values published on CNET and other sites with some minor tweaking. I am versed on calibrating TVs although I do not have test equipment. From a straight on viewing angle the black level is very good and the contrast is outstanding.  The black level actually looks even better during the day when there is more light in the room - looking as dark as the bezel.  In low light the blacks are not as dark as they could be, but better than almost all other LCDs.  The colors are also very accurate and high definition signals really look amazing.  I believe that the type of screen helps with the contrast and black level, but it is reflective.  However, even in my heavily windowed great room in the day the reflections are not that noticeable when watching.Standard definition looks pretty good given the limitations of SD and the incoming signal. The AMP function does its job and I don't see any noticeable artifacts, but it does cause the soap opera effect, making things look like video instead of film.  I usually turn it off except for sports on occasion. One thing I noticed was some scrolling text is sometimes jerky, but that can be resolved using the Film mode setting of Auto 2.Negatives: The only real disappointment I have is with the viewing angle. The picture, while amazing from straight on, starts to degrade even 15-20 degrees off center. The black level rises and the contrast drops so the picture looks like there is a haze over it. I am very suprised about the many reviews here that say the viewing angle is outstanding and there is no loss in picture quality from the sides. While you can still see the picture from even very sharp angles the picture gets considerably washed out. Others who have posted otherwise must not be very critical in their viewing.Wish List: This is an outstanding TV.  There are only a couple requests I have to make it just about perfect:- Better viewing angle without loss of black and contrast- Light sensor to adjust the backlight based on the ambient room light- Ability to preset any configuration and easily switch between them- Direct buttons for adjusting backlight and AMP settings- Even better black levels- Less reflective screen- No touch of color - or the new gray one.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A650
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Martin
Reviews.Content: Given an HD input source (i.e., HD cable or DVD/Blue-Ray) the monitor will produce very sharp pictures.  Watching standard definition programs, however, is a bit disappointing.  Standard def video images appear blurred and there is visible pixelation.The remote control is easy to use with large buttons and a relatively intuitive layout.  Note: the Closed Caption button will only work if the TV is connected to your cable box via the "Antenna" input jack.  If you are connecting to your cable system via the component or HDMI jacks, then Closed Captioning can only be activated via the cable provider's remote control unit.Due to the many connection options provided with this unit, I had to contact Samsung technical support to get a better understanding of the various inputs for antenna, component and HDMI connections.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and price
Reviews.Author: James R. Spillane Jr.
Reviews.Content: This is our second Samsung LN46A650. Great TV. Price was excellent. I was a little bit concerned purchasing over the internet. Transaction was smooth. The white glove delivery was great. The delivery of this Tv was better than the prior purchase from a well known big bog store.

Reviews.Title: 650 model, second time
Reviews.Author: S. Polk
Reviews.Content: The first time, i ordered a 750 used model.  I had the red cracking issue, even though it was listed used-like new by warehouse.  so i asked amazon to return the 750, and purchased a 650.  the item was cracked terribly at the corner as if it had been dropped or abused in assembly or xport.  i returned both the 750 and the 650 that day.i was a little cautious on ordering another tv due to my bad luck.  but the reimbursement process was very accomodating.  it took almost 2 weeks, but credited right back to my card.  no hassle.in the meantime the 650 model had dropped 150ish bucks from 2 weeks prior.  i decided to give it another shot.this time a perfect tv arrived.  sound is a little to be desired, but picture and design beautiful.  after a little hassle, i am now very satisfied.i feel secure ordering and returning due to the ease of the reimbursement.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Robert Aitken "Robert Aitken yard man"
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color This TV works as advertised. Picture and sound quality are great. Integrates with other electronic products perfectly.It also looks great and is so much lighter than my 42" plasma.

Reviews.Title: Amazing price for outstanding picture quality
Reviews.Author: DWCliff
Reviews.Content: Couldn't pass up on this deal especially with additonal $200 off with 'samtv200' coupon.Loved the buying experience...no shipping costs or taxes....and the tv arrived in about 4 days in great shape by CEVA Logistics.Setup was easy especially with the many HDMI connections. The only problem I had was the 'need' to update all my home theater equipment...new blu-ray player, new audio equipment, new furniture to put under lcd.Love the ease of operating the device and the picture quality is incredible. I am coming from a high end projection tv (about 6 years old) that was HD, but there is no comparison to the new Samsung. Vivid colors, amazing detail and I've even been impressed that non-HD signals are even quite clear.All in all...a great buying experience....great deal...great tv.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46" LCD HD TV
Reviews.Author: Maruta Gardner
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have purchased a "big ticket" item from Amazon.  They were terrific!  Great service on the telephone, answered all our questions, and quick delivery of the TV. There was no sales tax and no shipping fees.  They even took it out of the box, plugged it in to make sure it was working, and took away all of the packaging. We had a local company recommended by Amazon come to do the actual installation and hook-ups to all of our systems. The Samsung TV itself is a great product and just what we wanted.  Amazing picture and sound. I would definitely recommend it AND Amazon!

Reviews.Title: needed repair,
Reviews.Author: Susan M. Bautista
Reviews.Content: TV turns off and on by itself.It needed firmware update. Then continued to turn off by itself. Had authorized repair and continued to turn off and on by its self. Needs second repair.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: E. Frechette
Reviews.Content: Ordered after reading numerous positive reviews here and have been using the TV for about 3 weeks now. First model showed up with serious picture problems. After 10-15 a large bar of discolored or corrupted pixels would appear mid-screen. Called the shipper, Amazon, and Samsung in order to initiate the replacement process. I have to admit, Amazon stepped up immediately, shipping the replacement TV the next day.  Had to wait 5 more business days for the new TV to arrive, but man was it worth it! I use this TV exclusively as a monitor for my PS3 and DVD player. If you are looking for an excellent monitor for gaming at 1080P, look no further. This TV at this price is a fantstic package. Every game looks beautiful and the HDMI to optical audio out works perfectly with my surround sound system. Haven't hooked up an HDTV source, but will eventually and I am confident the image quality will be superb. Blu-ray videos look fantastic, and the 120Hz refresh rate makes for optimal playback of 24fps movies. The only con I can think of is the heat, but for a lamp lit LCD, heat radiation is very reasonable - only slightly warmer than my lamp lit 30" Samsung LCD computer monitor.I really would like to give 5 stars, but the initial problem with picture quality forces me to extend a word of caution. Combined with other comments, the potential for quality control issues is there, but do not let such concerns detur you from ordering. If you are looking for a high performance, high value HDTV, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Why did I wait so long? This set is awesome.
Reviews.Author: S. Helm "Steeler Fan"
Reviews.Content: I've been looking to upgrade from a 37" Phillips for over three months. I've read many reviews from all over the internet and the likes of Amazon and BestBuy. 60hz vs 120hz? gloss vs. matte finish, you name it I looked at it all. There are a lot of good looking sets out there, but the Samsung just blows the others away. The LN46A650 looks stunning especially with the TOC red, and it does have the glossier screen which enhances the contrast. When I first turned the channel to the Master's Golf, it was like I was sitting there at the course. So clear and the colors are so vibrant. The set up was very easy, although I haven't taken the time yet to go through the manual and learn the remote yet.Ok, if you are thinking about 60hz vs. 120hz, go for the 120hz. You will be glad you did, especially if you like sports like hockey where the action is fast. No blurring screens.I bought the TV on a Monday night, and it was delivered promptly on Friday. They uppacked it, set it up and made sure that everything was working fine. Kudos to Amazon as I called them and the let me know exactly where my set was on the day of delivery.Several people have commented about the sound. When speakers are facing down, you aren't going to get the same sound of front facing speakers but chances are you will be hooking up to a sound system anyway.So if you are looking for a great looking tv, and one that has an absolutely stunning picture, then this one is for you.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: C. D. Ellis "fonzy"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews prior to purchasing this TV and was aware that the volumn was an issue.  I didn't think it would be a problem for me since I rarely listen to a loud TV.  Trust the reviews.  There have been insances where I have had to turn the volumn up to 100 and still could barely hear the TV, even when I am in a room by myself.  Not sure if installing surround sound will help, but this is an option I am considering.  Eveything else about the TV is great.

Reviews.Title: There's a reason for 5 star ratings....
Reviews.Author: Q. Nguyen "YeOldeLancer"
Reviews.Content: All the reviews here are accurate and there's a reason this is the only tv with 800+ PERFECT ratings....because this is a PERFECT TV.  everyone else out there that rated this TV for less was complaining about things other than the TV itself, like amazon's service, shipping, or something else totally unrelated.  The picture quality is unbeatable.  There is no other TV out there in the market right now (other than Samsung's NEW line for 2009) that even compares the sharpness, vibrance, life and quality of picture this TV shows.  OTA channels are clear, but in order to get the most out of this, hook up your Blu-ray player, PS3 or Xbox 360.  That's where all of the beauty is.The speakers are more robust than what most people say, they only put out 10 watts, so don't expect furniture rattling sound, but they will play sound well at normal listening levels.  It's most likely that if you are going to get a TV this size that you'll have a home theater system hooked up or on the way so sound shouldn't be an issue regardless.If you want pure visual perfection, get this TV.  If you want subpar, overly expensive picture, look elsewhere.  Also, NO GLARE ISSUES!

Reviews.Title: Upgraded from 32 in - Best purchase ever!
Reviews.Author: GLesn84475
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to start off by saying I purchased this TV back in February 09.
