Reviews.Content: No problem with this TV!  The White Glove Service was excellent and set up the TV on schedule.  We love it thus far.  Only issue was setting up the broadband connection for the USA Today RSS feeds -- had to manually specify the IP information needed.

Reviews.Title: A great HDTV
Reviews.Author: K. Poon
Reviews.Content: I use Comcast cable and can scan to watch DTV channels. The pictures are great. The delivery was scheduled on my expected day and they set up everything (TV & clean up) for you. The color is wonderful and the TV is easy to operate. After a month, I didn't find any problem. I connected the TV to the Bose sound system. The sound effect is really perfect. I am really satisfied with this product & the price.

Reviews.Title: great HDtv
Reviews.Author: C. Arsenault
Reviews.Content: We love the tv. Great picture and sound. We had a bit of an issue when delivered for the first time(broken), but Amazon fixed it very quickly.We are very happy!!

Reviews.Title: A truly great TV
Reviews.Author: S. Baldonado "S Baldonado"
Reviews.Content: This TV is wonderful!  After having bought the Samsung 46" Lnt4671 and having it stolen from our home, I decided to go ahead and buy from Amazon again.  This time I bought this TV and we just think it is great.  AND the price has gone down 2 times since I purchased it (since there is a 30 day period when you can get a refund if the price decreases.  I am getting back a total of $323.63.  Yoohoo!!

Reviews.Title: Best LCD I've seen
Reviews.Author: Megan E. Swezey
Reviews.Content: Great TV. I love the red tint and in my opinion this doesn't distract from the picture. Colors on the set are amazing, and 120hz auto motion really works well. I love samsung, for the price and quality you can't beat this line of tvs.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Carlos Chapa "Doc"
Reviews.Content: Simply the best TV I've seen... and the price is great as well!I've seen the SONY's and felt the XBR was a bit over my budget (I've owned prior XBRs and they ROCK).The TV is not only super bright, the picture quality and 120 mhz gives you amazing quality. Almost 3D'ish.I even watched the free HD DVDs that came w/ my HD player (cheesy movies), just to watch and enjoy it in 1080p.I'm happy and in loved.Just not happy I got the 12 months = 0% (instead of many other places offering 24 or 36 months)

Reviews.Title: Fast HDTV... Great price!
Reviews.Author: John Parducho "TALLflip64"
Reviews.Content: After doing some price comparison's with Best Buy, Pacific Sales, Circuit City, ebay, and Amazon.com...  Amazon.com came out on top.  Price is tough to beat for one of the fastest HDTV's (120Hz and 4ms response time) out on the market today.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and a good price
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I had mainly been focused on the one of the Samsung 120Hz or Sony XBR4 models.  After having watched prices for a couple of months and checking out CNET as well as other reviews, I finally jumped in.  Originally, I was leaning more toward the Sony but wasn't willing to spend 25% more than what I ended up paying for the Samsung.  The biggest hesitation that I had was the shiny screen of the Samsung since we were putting this TV in a bright room.  I have no regrets.  The picture is outstanding and the shiny screen is not the distraction I thought it would be.After attempting to make a reasonable deal at the local electronic stores, I decided to give Amazon a shot since the price was about 10% below anything else I could find locally even including the shipping costs.  The TV was delivered in less than a week with no issues despite super saver shipping option and expecting it to take longer.  Having had good experiences with my previous Amazon purchases, although nothing quite as large, I was willing to give Amazon a shot.  I was very pleased with the TV and overall purchase through delivery experience.  I would highly recommend the Samsung A650 model and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Job Samsung
Reviews.Author: Outlaw
Reviews.Content: This is one great 46" LCD HDTV, great picture resolution with large viewing angle,good audio and the on screen menu is user friendly which makes programming a breeze. If you're a sports fan the PIP is another great attribute. The remote control wheel will take a little time to get use to but that's no big problem, besides I use a Logitech Harmony programmable remote.  I did have to upgrade the firmware, because it would just turn off after a period of use.  The upgrade was quick and easy and corrected the problem.  I'm 100% satisfied with this product. It was delivered by Eagle and they were great in unpacking and setting it up, all around good deal.

Reviews.Title: Astonishing LCD
Reviews.Author: see Spot run
Reviews.Content: Have had the set 5+ weeks.  Amazing black levels make for vibrant life-like colors.  Flesh tones are consistentlydead-on regardless of source.  I have researched flat screens for over a year and Samsung hit the ball out of the park with this one.  A plethora of logical picture adjustments from A-Z.  A bit of glare can be an issue but well worth the gain in overall contrast.  Yes, the remote is quirky at first, but reasonably effective after a few uses. TOC is interesting but I can take it or leave it.  Sound quality is average at best.  For typical programming the set's audio system is fine but for movies and such, you'll want to switch on your home audio system for added dimension.  Amazon and Eagle's level of service was flawless.  If you still are uncertain, check out CNET's review of this TV.  Bottom line: Each time I turn on this set, I continue to be astonished over the PQ.  The wait is over!  Finally LCD technology that is on par with the best plasma sets!!!

Reviews.Title: Favorite new toy...
Reviews.Author: L. Bruce Anderson "Bruce"
Reviews.Content: Amazing!!! That is the only way to describe this TV!! The picture is flawless!! The options are endless, and the price is the best that I could find. If you are thinking about upgrading to a new TV, you have just found the one that you should get.

Reviews.Title: A review from SoCal Desert Cities
Reviews.Author: Scott Tracewell
Reviews.Content: A Great HDTV.  Makes other LCD's look dull.  It's bright, sharp, clear and has deep blacks.  Setup was relatively easy (took me 30 minutes - and that's only because I couldn't believe I wouldn't need half of the existing wires/cables).  HDMI vs. DVI/audio cables reduced the wire clutter - one HDMI replaced 5 seperate cables.  Delivery was promised in 5 days, I received it in 3.  Delivery personnel removed TV from the box and set on stand, inspected for scratches, etc. TV is also Energy Star!  The entire process (purchase thru installation)was positive and exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: WOW I Love This TV!!
Reviews.Author: David C. Maier
Reviews.Content: Ok this is my first HDTV and I know going from SD to HD is a jump but some friends have HDTVs and mine blows theirs out of the water.  I love the pic and the colors.  I love this TV.  I would not buy another one.  Mine shut off only once in a month and I have noticed no other concerns that are known about this TV.  I would recommend this TV to anyone interested in HDTV.  Don't pay the extra for a Sony.  I am currently using setting found on AVS Forum and I think it is better quality than the Sony.  I think the PQ rivals some quality Plasma PQ.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic You must buy one
Reviews.Author: Anthony M. Griffiths
Reviews.Content: This Samsung TV is the best, I spent over 6mths doing research and when I saw the price on Amazon, delivered to my front door,I jumped at it. The product was unpacked wired up and checked out by the delivery firm before they left, fantastic service. The picture is out of this world, all my friends are blown away by it, and they already have LCD Tv's.It came with the updated software installed and has been faultless, if your looking for a LCD TV stop looking and buy this one you will not be disappointed,best value around,superb picture,and from a leading manufacturer,Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Junk -- Lasted 13 months
Reviews.Author: M. Kelly
Reviews.Content: We purchsed this tv in January of 2008 and were very happy with it until about a month ago when it started giving us problems turning on.  At first it would click for about 30 seconds and eventually power up.  As the days went by it took longer and longer for the tv to actually turn on.  Eventually taking over 5 minutes from when you hit power.  A friend of ours bought the same model at the same time and his stopped turning on completely.  A product that costs this much should last a lot longer than 1 year.  I don't consider flat screen tvs to be disposable.  Now ours is in a repair shop, but please save yourself the trouble and don't buy this tv.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Charlene C. Trapp
Reviews.Content: the tv has great picture quality. we also have sony's 52xbr4 series. people are always wondering the difference between the sony and the samsung. for picture quality i have to say it's the same.however, the edge for interface goes to sony. if you scan for channels, and it doesn't pick it up for the first time around, you can't go to it. for instance, we knew there was a digital channel at 11-1, but the samsung wouldn't let us go there because it wasn't on its list of channels. i have to rescan ALL channels again to pick it up. on the sony, if it misses a channel, you can still go there. i found this to be annoying on the samsung.btw, we have basic cable and wanted to pick up digital and HDTV cable signals.updated on 6/8/2010I regret getting this TV or any samsung. I didn't realize that the tuner is cheap. If you plan on connecting this tv to your cable directly (no box or directv) and plan on picking up un-encrpted HDTV this is NOT for you. I didn't see this as a comment on any of the posts. The only reason I knew this was an issue was when my sony tv downstairs would pick up channels that Samsung wouldn't.It also changes channels on you (esp digital ones) if the channel gets "weak". WHAT TV does that?Please, please do yourself a favor and get a Sony. this tv has been taken down from the bedroom and moved to a lounge area. totally useless.

Reviews.Title: Great!  Until the Warranty runs out...
Reviews.Author: J. Cameron Mccormick
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV last February and it came with a 1-year warranty...  14 months later this thing goes on the fritz.  The power starts flicking on and off repeatedly.I call Samsung and they are NO help; they keep telling me to go on [...] to find my nearest service agent and when I do that the 'nearest service agent is in Arizona (I'm in Illinois).  Just for the fun of it I looked it up and they are over 1600 miles away. -No help.I give up on Samsung and call a local repair guy; he comes out and changes some caps which is usually the problem, but not this time apparently.  Turns out to be the T-Con board and he says that they don't sell those without the whole screen attachment and it would cost $1400 to fix (bought the TV for $1350).I get online and found a store that sells Samsung T-Con Panels and they seem to have every other T-Con panel but mine.  I googled the product number (LJ63-05707A) and it got ONE HIT.  Unfortunately that one hit was a website telling me they had no matches.After plenty of research I've discovered that this is a recurring problem with this model and Samsung simply tries to ignore or hide it.  I'm going to post this everywhere I possibly can to try and get the word out.I can't bear to throw away a $1400 TV so I guess it's going in the basement and I'll check every couple of months to see if that part comes on the market.

Reviews.Title: Could be brighter; doesn't work with 3D.
Reviews.Author: P. Janes
Reviews.Content: "Movie" mode is too dim; other modes sacrifice dynamic range.Watching "Journey to Center of Earth" in 3D: This TV, in combination with Samsung's BD1500 Bluray player, does not completely separate the right and left images; and sometimes bright portions of the right image produce dark sections in the left & vice versa. This is a software error which Samsung could correct with a digital update, but they have not yet done so.

Reviews.Title: PiP is a worthless feature...
Reviews.Author: Bill T.
Reviews.Content: Everything about this TV is superb EXCEPT the Picture-in-Picture mode is a totally worthless feature. It only displays analog broadcasts. Well, we all know that shortly there will be ZERO analog broadcasts ( unless, of course, you live near our southern border, speak Spanish and want to watch Spanish language channels). Sansung should either fix this feature or remove it and reduce the price appropriately.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Diane Lengyel "D.L."
Reviews.Content: We're enjoying our new TV.  Great picture.  Nice appearance.  Only "annoyance" is the remote.  It's curved to fit in your hand better which is nice, but when we go to set it down on a table you have to make sure you don't leave any part of it hanging over the edge or it falls off.  It's not a big deal, just annoying.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Product, Terrible Delivery Service
Reviews.Author: Darrin D. Demarco
Reviews.Content: The product itself is truly everything I expected.  The only thing stopping it from being a 5 star rating, is the delivery service.  Everything from Xbox 360, to PS3, to Blu-Ray movies look amazing on it, and I actually like the functionality and ease of use the TV has.  The picture is beautiful, sharp, and the blacks are deep and inky.  Having easy access to all the inputs, and the 4 HDMIs, is a great feature.  I don't have any problems with the remote, as I have heard other people complain about.  I'll most likely purchase a Logitech down the road, anyway.The TV is surprisingly light for its size, which is nice when we wanted to rearrange our living room to accomodate it.  I have been researching LCD's for a while, looking for the right one at a good price, and I am definitely more than satisfied with my purchase.Now CEVA's shipping, on the other hand, was absolutely ridiculous.  They called me the day before delivery, and asked what floor I lived on (5th), if there is an elevator (no), and what time I would prefer it to be delivered (morning).  I took a half day off from work to have it delivered, and they ended up not showing up until almost 4 o'clock.  When it finally showed up, I went downstairs to meet the driver.  He was unloading it, and asked if there was an elevator, and looked upset when I told him no.  I informed him that I indicated to the CEVA agent on the phone that I live in a 5th floor walk-up apartment.  He then "asked" me to help him carry it up.  Luckily, I am in great physical shape, but he was panting and wheezing by the time we reached the top.  He then realized that he left his truck in the middle of the street, and vehicles were honking at him to move it.  I told him he should go down and move it, but he refused.  He then said "All I have to do is turn it on."  I had to tell him to be careful, as he hurridly opened the box and put the TV on my stand.  He then uttered "There, beuatiful, it works" and had me sign the delivery form.  I quickly made sure it did indeed work with my Xbox360 before he left, which was a challenge, as he dashed out of my apartment.Everything did work fine, but I did file a complaint with CEVA, although it was free shipping, so what do you expect?  White-glove, it was not.  Amazon handled things great on their end, but go with a different shipping service, that has actual white-glove service and installation.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG 46 inch
Reviews.Author: K. Perks
Reviews.Content: I researched and researched on a TV purchase for the longest time driving my wife nuts. I did go to Circuit City which was much more helpful that Best Buy to answer some questions. One thing I found very helpful on making my decision was all the comments here on Amazon. All these guys before me really helped ensure my decision and helped clarify my concerns and questions. Right now it's killing me because I'm at work and my TV is waiting for me to get home and hook it up...but it's out of the box and looks amazing. I've seen this version at Best Buy (40inch) and the picture is amazing. True colors, no blur, and hardly any glare on the screen. Amazon saved me approx. $600 (plus free shipping and 24 months interest free) comapred to Best Buy. And Even comapring this 650 series to the newest versions, there were minor differences...the 650 was the way to go for us. It is just as high tech and current as you could go right now. Lots of features and will stay current and steady for what's to come in the next few years.**One thing to any of you looking for a TV like this....make sure you get one big enough. This 46 inch is perfect for our size living room and distance. We were actually thinking 40 inch until someone at Circuit City pointed out to us the difference and noted a lot of their returns are because the TV was and looked too small in their living room.Also,Just wanted to say the delivery I got this morning was excellent. I also spoke to someone in customer service (Tracy) at CEVA that was very, very helpful and friendly on the phone. Unlike other customer services, she and the delivery drivers goofed aroud, were personable, and so not punched out and corporate sounding, refering to their manuals for replies to my questions and comments. A+ for CEVA.CEVA did a great job.

Reviews.Title: I used to love it
Reviews.Author: C. maury "dango579"
Reviews.Content: First off, I'm glad my girlfriend convinced me to pick this 46 inch TV instead of the 52 inch I was dying for. They don't look that big when you look at them at the retail stores ( I bought it from Amazon, of course. I just went to a retail store to see what they look like). When I first got it, I had to push my furniture all the way against the wall, because the screen was so big, I just couldn't get used to it right away (I just upgraded from a 32 inch LCD). I'm in the process of buying a house with a nice recreational room, so pretty soon that won't be a problem anymore. Ok, about the TV:It looks just great.  It's just gorgeous and very nice to look at. The screen resolution is amazing. At the beginning, I just couldn't get used to the "soap opera effect", but after I turned it off I felt the movies looked even better. Although I own a PS3, I am not a gamer. I only use it to watch blu ray movies, and yes, you can appreciate even the smallest details in the picture. Sound wise, I feel it is just ok, but I don't mind because I have a home theater.Overall, I just feel that I got a great deal on it and I am extremely satisfied. Like many consumers, I did my research, and read as many reviews as possible.*****UPDATE 02/10/2010****Ok, this is an update on how I feel about this TV after a year of ownership.This is what I really HATE about the TV:1)The speakers: Those speakers are a joke. They are very weak. In fact, they make a distortion noise if you increase the volume. This matter, I don't care that much about, because I own a very good sound system, but it sucks when I just want to watch regular television.2)Mode not supported message: This message will come up all of the sudden when I'm either playing with my PS3, or when watching a blu ray movie. I spoke to both Samsung, and Sony and their solution was to bring down the resolution to 1080 I ( and I still have the same problem), or below (720 or lower). Then my question arises "why in hell did I spend that much in a HDTV if I can't watch a stupid movie in 1080 p whenever I feel like it????If my tax return is what I'm expecting it to be, I may just enjoy throwing a dam hammer at this overpriced tv.Other than that it's a cute looking tv

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: B. Kem
Reviews.Content: This is a awesome TV, but I was trading from a Philips that I found had better 120hz processing. I almost didn't keep the Samsung because it had so much "ghosting" that the Philips didn't show at all. The solution I came to was setting the "Auto Motion Plus 120hz" to MEDIUM (I'd say they shouldn't even have low and high, just off and on, at the medium setting).Other than that, the viewing angle is alright, but also not as good as the Philips. I had a Mistubishi that was the same way, you lose contrast as soon as you move from directly in front. but it's not a huge issue or what I'd really call a problem. The Samsung stays much cooler than the Philips and the menu system is great. A lot of people complain about the remote, but I don't have a problem with it. If you hate the wheel, push down on it instead of spinning, it works that way too. (nice looking, glossy, "beefy" remote, too.)the WiseLink feature knows when I load a DVD and switches to the DVD input, even though the player's not Samsung (...using a HDMI cable).I haven't plugged in an ethernet cable to try the infolink feature, but it's kinda cool to know it's an option.Overall, I'm very happy with the Samsung, and Amazon's price was about $500 less than the local electronic's retailer's best match offer.I almost forgot, mine came with one side of the box smashed which I took photos of before I even opened the box. When I removed the TV I found a scuffed area on the glossy frame. Though it seriously bothers me, I didn't file a complaint, but I know had I returned the TV for whatever reason, they would've said I did it and tried to make me pay for the damage. I'd make the currier company open it, and examine it closely if I were you.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A650 46 inch
Reviews.Author: David Pursi "Dave"
Reviews.Content: This is my first LCD TV it is the best I have ever had great picture. I would buy another one of these you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but you can't sent it 1080p signal
Reviews.Author: William Mcshane "Bill"
Reviews.Content: My Blu-ray will send out 1080p on the 1.3 HDMI cable, but the screen goes all green and pink.  1080i signal from Blu-ray looks sweet; no problems with 1080i or below.  I called Samsung and reached Tier 2 support.  The tech guy (not the friendly Tier 1 operator) said this TV will not except a 1080p signal but it will display in the progressive (not the interlaced) mode.  That does not make much sense to me since I thought the "p" in progressive meant every line per frame was sent in the signal, and the "i" in interlaced meant that every other line was sent per frame to the screen.  If the TV displays every line per frame, why not except a signal with every line per frame.Also, the 120 Hz auto motion plus feature makes special effects where they use the green screen with real people look weird and distracting.  The action looks like it is on a different layer than the people. I have the 120 Hz feature turned to the low setting and that seems to be a happy medium.The picture and the colors are great.  Even my regular 480i DVDs look great.  The Blu-ray movies are sweet.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: MC0282
Reviews.Content: In short the TV is perfect, the picture is amazing.  Samsung provided a deep menu for in depth fine tuning if desired or great pre-set options for beginners.  Plenty of input choices 4 HDMI inputs, 2 Component, 1 Composite and a USB, it even has an RJ45 to connect to the internet and get weather and news updates.  It has 120hz capability if you like it and you can turn it off if you don't.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING !
Reviews.Author: Doug Gibbons
Reviews.Content: AMAZING PICTURE ! THIS IS SIMPLY THE BEST TV I'VE EVER OWNED. HD AND BLU-RAY LOOK INCREDIBLE AND SD CHANNELS ARE VERY GOOD AS WELL. I'VE OWNED SONY HD PLASMA'S, SHARP LCD'S AND NONE OF THEM CAN COMPARE TO THE SAMSUNG.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: F. T. Fisher
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv.  I was worried about buying a tv online without seeing it in person,  but the picture and sound are excellent.  This tv is better than the others that we saw in stores.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV, CEVA (EGL) delivery service needs to be more professional
Reviews.Author: Sunshine "Sunny"
Reviews.Content: My TV arrived 2 days ahead of schedule but the delivery guys were not very professional.  They carried the TV to my ground floor living room and asked me if they needed to unbox/ setup the TV for me.  Their attitude changed when I told them I will tip them if they will set it up and move my old TV to the garage as well.  The guys proceed to setup the TV and did some simple testings (insisted by me) but did not offer to throw away the box.The TV so far has been great for the one week that I have owned it.

Reviews.Title: Out of the Box Perfection
Reviews.Author: T. Dessaso
Reviews.Content: After reviewing so many types of LCD HDTVs, we finally picked the Samsung.  Out of the box the image was perfect!  There are so many types of inputs available as well.  We are very pleased with the TV and have recommended this model to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Salvatore Tepedino
Reviews.Content: This Samsung TV LN46A650 is without a doubt the best TV I've owned.The picture,when receiving HD transmission,is brilliant.When receiving other than HD the picture quality is quite good. DVD's are excellent. I've got an upgrade to 1080p DVD player and find myself questioning whether or not I need a Blue Ray. The sound quality is acceptable but since I channel Audio through my receiver it's not an issue. The 120hz setting along with the Dynamic setting make DVD's appear lifelike. This TV produces one hell of a viewing experience.For the price you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: T. Duffy
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this TV. I was very disappointed that this unit does not have a variable volume output. I use the audio from my receiver so I have to use two remotes to control the volume control and channel selection. I am use to using Sonys variable audio output so I could control everything with one remote. I also found the limitation of video inputs to be limited. I guess I could buy a new equipment but the ones I have do not allow for the new connections so there are limitation on connecting older VCRs and DVD player that don't have the new connections. These are minor but still important items that Samsung does not seem to think are important. Overall, still very nice and glad I bought it. Terry

Reviews.Title: Samsung and Amazon ...a great team!
Reviews.Author: R. M. Lane
Reviews.Content: Amazon had the best price.The "white glove" delivery was perfect. They delivered the TV when promised, they removed the packaging and put the TV on our table, and turned it on in less than 5 minutes. The delivery people were courteous and friendly.The Samsung LN46A650 is a great TV. Picture was awesome right out of the box.I could not ask for more...Great Price, Delivery, & Product!!!!

Reviews.Title: Just Purchased the TofC Samsung 46 inch
Reviews.Author: Lou Oliphant
Reviews.Content: The picture is crisp and clean -great refresh rate of 120 and 50,000/1 contrast ratiowonderful product so far

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Orphanannie
Reviews.Content: We have loved Samsung products and when we originally purchased this tv it received great reviews. We have had it now 3 years and suddenly two days before superbowl vertical colored lines took over the entire screen and have not gone away.  When I hit the internet to find out what the problem was I was very surprised to see the pages and pages of people having the exact same problem.  Seems we were lucky because most others had their problem show up after a year or less.  We will not be purchasing a samsung product anytime in the near future.  We are looking at a $600 repair or buy a new tv...

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color
Reviews.Author: BIP "IGOR"
Reviews.Content: the best product Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz LCD HDTV with Red Touch of Color

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A650
Reviews.Author: S. K. Gilmer
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with our new Samsung LN46A650 TV.  I installed it in our master bedroom.  The picture is very bright and clear.  We like the overall look of the unit, too!

Reviews.Title: Delivered Perfect
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: Would definitely buy thru Amazon again. TV came in perfect condition. Delivery men set it up, checked for any damages, & made sure it worked properly. Deliver Co. called 2 days prior to delivery & set up delivery window when someone would be home.  Nice & easy!

Reviews.Title: The best TV i've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Darrell
Reviews.Content: I've had the LN46A650 for a month now and what can I say that hasn't been said. I'm loving this TV!! If your sitting on the fence as whether to buy or not, do yourself a favor,BUY IT!!

Reviews.Title: Some Good Some Bad
Reviews.Author: W. F. Wilson "bwcando"
Reviews.Content: The price was good. The sound is good without surround. Some have said the glare was bad in direct light. But I have not found that to be true. I get direct light and there is no glare. The remote is only fair. Not easy to use.  The so called invisible controls on the right front side are almost usless and the kids seem to hit them by mistake and change things. I would move them to the side of the set. But all in all a good set. The picture is clear for digital but analog a little fuzzy.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN46A650 TV
Reviews.Author: RW
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV!  Great color and clarity.  Great price.  I mounted it on the wall using the Samsung motorized mount that is controlled by the TV remote.  Not only was the mount a tremendous bargain (cheaper than most non-motorized wall mounts at my local big-box store), it was designed especially for Samsung TVs and was a snap to install.  I particularly like the ability for the mount to memorize three settings (again selected via the TV remote) to allow the TV to be viewed from three pre-set locations.  Just pick you favorite chair, use the remote to position the TV just perfectly, and then save the setting under one of the memory buttons.  Move to another viewing location and repeat.  Recall the appropriate setting for your viewing location with the touch of the correct button.  Neat!And, BTW, the TV and mount were delivered on time and in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46 Inch
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M. Bosco
Reviews.Content: Pros- Awesome LCD TV.  Amazing Picture on Blu Ray and Video Games.Love the red tint color around the frame.  Had a Sharp Aquos, I would take Samsung over it.Cons- The Black stand attracks alot of dust.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Image
Reviews.Author: Matthew L. Luedtke
Reviews.Content: I absolutley love the image from this tv..Not to mention the price..I checked around and this beat Best But by almost 600!  Only thing I dislike is the spin wheel on the remote, it is way over  sensitive and basically pointless.  Other than that works great for my video games as well..Except,Fable 2 had really bad motion blur gave me a migraine. But all my others look amazing, must be the way the game is programmed. Easy set up.  Sound I don't really care about from the unit itself since it is hooked up in surround, but I do use it late night and it sounds fine for that.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with our decision
Reviews.Author: Jared Edward Gentilucci
Reviews.Content: My wife and I waited a long time before buying a new TV, and we're very happy with our purchase.  Great picture, lots inputs for DVD player, video game systems, etc., and it's a nice looking TV to boot.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 650 lcd tv
Reviews.Author: Mountaineer Don
Reviews.Content: Love this tv. Great picture, enough inputs, does just what I needed to handle digital photos as well. Only bought it a month ago, and no problems at all so far. Delivery was prompt, set was put on the base, the only problem was that the bottom of the box was very dirty, requiring local cleaning of our carpet. Didn't realize how dirty till the box was moved after opening.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Bob G. "lumpy9500"
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I split the price on the Samsung LCD and we have been using it for a month.It's our first HDTV and it is awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV overall
Reviews.Author: Sonesh Mittal
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best purchases I have made, yes the price is a bit shaky but I won't mind since I wanted the TV now not after BlackFriday :-).The only issue I have seen with this TV: Pixelation on HD channels when connected to the same outlet as my DTV HD Receiver is connected to and my Fan's light is ON.Nobody could tell the real issue, so at this moment the I have plugged the power of the TV in another room to make it work.

Reviews.Title: We Love our 46 inches
Reviews.Author: Thomas Haas
Reviews.Content: Tremendous picture on HD.  Normal channels, just so-so.  Perhaps I need to make some adjustment.

Reviews.Title: It Don't Get NO BETTER
Reviews.Author: Rickf178
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with RED Touch of ColorI did the research, I read everything I could find about HD TV's and after 90 days of searching to fine the best TV at the best price I bought the Samsung LN46A650. I search all types of sites to try to get the best possible deal overall, no tax, no service charge and free shipping from a reliable source. I thought about trying to save a few bucks and go with some of the NY sites but after reading some of those nightmire expericences I decided to go with Amazon. I bought it at $1,670.02 with the $200.00 something from some sport site. I was told my TV would be at my home by 9-12-08. I got a call on Monday 9-8-08 saying it was to be delivered 9-8-08. The TV came out th box perfect picture.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and great delivery service.
Reviews.Author: K. Richard
Reviews.Content: TV is great no complaints.  Would recommend both the TV and Amazon to anyone.

Reviews.Title: TV is a 5, Delivery was Not
Reviews.Author: MAH
Reviews.Content: (I would rate the TV a 5 but for some reason I couldn't get the rating star to move off of 3!)  It took 15 days for our TV to arrive due to issues with the freight company, who dropped the ball - but Amazon customer service was about the best customer service I have ever received - no long waits, no automated menus, no hard-to-understand accents, very nice, helpful people.  Anyway, we now have our TV and it is great!We had first purchased a VIZIO 47" 120hz from Costco (well-rated on Consumer Reports) but there is simply no comparison between the two TVs.  We are so glad we returned the Vizio and purchased this one (which rated high on Consumer Reports and cnet.com but also had a higher price tag.)  If you are in the market for a TV in this price range, my advice is don't buy the "bargain brand".  For about $100 more (no tax through Amazon and the price keeps dropping) we have a MUCH better TV.  The HD picture is obviously good but the SD picture is also very good - and this is straight out of the box - no adjustments.  (On the Vizio, we were constantly fiddling with all the adjustments to try and get a better picture.)  It is important for us to have good SD quality because our local channels are not available in HD through our satellite company yet and we watch a lot of network TV.The one thing we don't like is that the remote only works the TV!  Our satellite remote will work everything for basic functions, but it obviously won't access the TV menus, etc. so we are stuck having two remotes around.I highly recommend this TV and the purchase through Amazon, despite the delivery problems.  I have never had a problem with Amazon before and it was nice to find out what great customer service they have.  I don't think anyone will be disappointed by this TV.  (On a side note, we purchased an extended warranty and still have not received it!!)

Reviews.Title: Oh boy, not good!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Schiller "Tech Geek"
Reviews.Content: Well, past few years I have been a Samsung fan of their ability to be at the forefront of new technology in viewing entertainment. Their quality control issues need to be remedied and leaves ALOT to be desired. I bought my first one online from a large and reputable seller and came to me in a box that looked descent only to find vertical lines in the picture (which samsung has a serious problem with) I sent back that one but I still wanted this tv and I was stuck on getting it. So I bought mine from Amazon here not long after they came out. Box looked good and operated fine UNTIL NOW!Purchase date 8/20/08No picture and just sound on 4/9/10Wow simply wow,This television was never disturbed since it was mounted, never dropped and used mostly with standard analog cable and some blu-ray and used in a controlled environment.Unbelievable, I stand by Samsung still on the forefront of viewing technology BUT, and this is a big butt.  They have quality issues as you will find around on the internets.  This television was an investment to last and apparently Samsung doesn't last with my experience and many ppl on AV forums.  Now maybe I should have got extended warranty? Should that be considered a must nowadays? With the poor components and testing that they seem to be doing?I am looking across from my computer monitor right now at a black screen and sound. A 1,600.00 dollar sound machine.I am thinking there is better fish in the water elsewhere, all done with sammy.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A. Consentino "Anthony"
Reviews.Content: This set is nothing short of amazing!  The people talking about the remote not being user-friendly haven't ever used an ipod that's all.  Any TV has glare if it is being hit directly with sunlight, so supposed glare issues are due to stupid people.  HD cable and Bluray are amazing.  This is from a certified audio/videophile.  Amazon had the best price and the received set and blu-ray player 5 days after order.  This set is as good as it gets without spending $5,000+.  You will not be let down!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazon LCD Rebate Ripoff
Reviews.Author: Todd D. White
Reviews.Content: Great TV - excellent picture.  However, Amazon ripped me (and thousands of other customers) off by not honoring a cash rebate.  The LCD price was to be reduced by a $200 cash rebate.  After I (and thousands of others) purchased the LCD, Amazon changed their tune and said the rebate was for a $200 gift certificate of "sports memorabilia" - what a joke.  After several phone calls and emails in which they confirmed my side of the story, they are claiming the cash rebate was a mistake but yet the still refuse to honor the cash rebate - unbelievable.  I've never seen this kind of horrible customer service and I am very unlikely to ever purchase anything else from Amazon plus I'm telling all of my friends about this ridiculous company.  Watch out people - these guys a sharks!!!!!  You can check out the Amazon blog on Amazon's website and see how terribly Amazon treat its loyal customers!!!

Reviews.Title: Shuts down randomly
Reviews.Author: extemp
Reviews.Content: I have had a 40" Sony (V2500) for over a year, and it's great.  I wanted my second HDTV to have a larger screen and a faster pixel response to address the motion issue.  This Samsung seemed to have everything I was looking for in an upgrade - larger screen, more HDMI 1.3 ports, a USB port (for thumb drive slide shows), plus the 4ms pixel response, the 120 MHz processor, and color improvements clinched it.  I always thought Samsung was a quality alternative to Sony, but I don't anymore.  The picture was spectacular and the color more natural just like the advertising said, but on the 4th day the TV suddenly shut off for no reason and then turned itself back on about 3 seconds later.  This happened 4-5 times in 3 hours.  When I googled the problem, I got many hits about the same problem in a number of Samsung TVs.  It may be an overheating problem, a fan not working, or a bad sensor like some people guess, but after only 4 days I wasn't putting up with that.  I returned it to Best Buy and got a 46" Sony XBR5.  (Always stick with Sony!)  I rated this 2 stars because it really was good when it worked but disappointing overall.

Reviews.Title: Samsung support
Reviews.Author: Kenneth L. Wolfgang "first time samsung buyer"
Reviews.Content: I have had my set for about two months.  I have been having trouble with the HDMI/DVI input not utilizing the entire screen.  There is a two inch black band around the screen.  The manual talks about how to adjust the screen, but the menu items that they talk about does not exist.  I contacted samsung support and they were completely useless.  I have decided to suffer with this problem hoping that I can figure out a solution without their support, but I have also decided to never buy samsung again.  I had thought about buying a blu-ray player, but it will not be samsung.

Reviews.Title: Superb picture quality, but so-so TV and reliability
Reviews.Author: NEWBY "NEWBY"
Reviews.Content: All reviews about this HDTV are true.  Consumersearch.com has great review articles. The picture quality is simply marvelous. So, why only 2 stars?Well, the 2 star rating has nothing to do with the auto-off. The firmware update fixes the issue where the TV automatically turns itself off for no particular reason. The rating is a result of nagging issues such as long wait time for powering on, switching input sources, no audio when switching channels too quickly.False claims of PIP.  The PIP only works with non-HD source such as analog TV or VCR.  If you're trying to view two different HD source, forget it.For 1080P, again, the picture is fabulous when connecting to a Playstation 3 playing blu-ray.  But don't expect the PS3 or other DVD players with upscaling to perform miracles.  The PS3 can upscale and some movies looked pretty good, but other movies are just too grainy.High:Fabulous pictureDark is pretty dark (not totally black)Excellent colorsLow:Long wait time (10 sec) to power onLong wait time switching different sources (PS3, etc)PIP is only for analog sourcesMissing audio (remedy by switching to another channel and then back)HDMI is not any help with the issues.Updated: After one year of usage, the power supply went out. TV makes rapid chirping sound prior to power supply issue. Google capacitor bulging for Samsung and you'd see it's common failure. As I open the back of the TV to repair it, I'd noticed that the power supply is probably designed in the 60's and Samsung buys these in bulk for their TV. There is a major difference between the printed circuit board on the power supply versus the rest of the TV. Granted that the power supply's only to convert AC to DC, you would think that Samsung engineers would understand the power utilities in the United States.Updated 2: Well, I should've replaced all 4 capacitors in the power supply during my first repair. At that time I'd only replaced those bulging ones. On the second year of ownership, the power supply stopped working again. I'd initially thought it was my repaired work (replaced bulging caps), but after opening the TV again, I've found the other 2 caps blew. So only one star for reliability.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Adam B
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this television.  I was a little nervous about the "touch of color" not having seen the set in person prior to purchasing it.  However, now that I have it in front of me I'd have to say that the very faint color of red around the edge really adds a premium look to the set.I couldn't be happier with the picture and honestly I wouldn't expect anything less from Samsung.If I had a single complaint about any component of the set I guess it'd be with the remote.  While it's intuitive and very easy to use, it looks as though it was designed for someone who's almost completely blind... Honestly, if your vision is so poor that you need the buttons on your remote that large, what are you doing buying a high-def TV anyway?  I guess the over-sized button design would also favor the "fat fingered" viewer as well.  And who knows, with the amount of time I'm sure to be spending in front of this thing, the "fat finger design" might just come in handy.Hope that helps, I'm gonna go for a jog now...

Reviews.Title: "White Glove" delivery offer a sham
Reviews.Author: Root Admin
Reviews.Content: Have not yet connected to comcast HD at this writing and will follow up on this aspect. However:......As K. Morris stated below, the "White Glove Delivery" is a (sad) joke.  I cannot determine whether it is just certain delivery services.  In this case, PILOT DELIVERY! [Those who have a bad back: BEWARE!]. They did not fulfill the touted Amazon offer. They subcontracted to a local agent and I was fortunate in having them bring it inside.  PILOT DELIVERY!----Shame on You!!

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: bubba
Reviews.Content: it's a tv, it does what it does. the only minor drawback is that the inputs take about 1.5 to 2 seconds to switch from one to another. overall great tv.

Reviews.Title: unhappy
Reviews.Author: MN Maven
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with RED Touch of Color  We ordered an open box model from Amazon's Warehouse Deals.  After many assurances from Amazon staff that the tv was eligible for it, we ordered the 3 year extended warantee, too.  The day after we turned over our credit card info on both purchases, Amazon told us that our  Samsung was NOT eligible for extended warantee.  Needless to say, we were not going to take an open box model w/out the extended warantee.  After that, more Amazon staff people said it WAS qualified for extended warantee, and tried to sell us the extended warantee from other vendors.  What a mess.  Finally got things straightened out, and all the charges reversed.  Lessons learned: amazon staff do not always know what they are talking about; they did finally straighten it out, though.  In fact, the people assigned to straighten out the mess were very apologetic and sincere.

Reviews.Title: Great quality purchase and viewing experience.
Reviews.Author: E. Adams
Reviews.Content: The TV is performing better than expected and the purchase through Amazon warehouse was excellant.

Reviews.Title: My Samsung TV Review
Reviews.Author: Matthew A. Courduff
Reviews.Content: i bought this television about 4 months ago. It is the best tv i have ever bought. In this tv they advertise the 120Hz, they advertise this to make it seem very face(which it is) BUT with turning the settings up u tend to get large pixals infront or behind a object. So i have my settings on low. I have also bought the Best Buy calibration, the factor calibration is all right but the screen is SO bright which causes your tv's life to decrease. Also with the calibration i have saved 8$ in my electric bill each month and that is always nice. I suggest the Best Buy calibration for this tv u will see SUCH a big difference.

Reviews.Title: Better Than Expected
Reviews.Author: Dallas Sports Fan
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a month now, and could not be happier with it.  Once DirecTV got their act together (3 service calls to get the HD set up properly) I can really appreciate the greatness of this set.  The picture quality is far superior to any other set I have seen, including my parents' Pioneer Elite plasma set.  The main reason we bought it is for watching football and hockey, and though we have not seen any hockey on it yet, the picture for football is better than being at the game.  The 120HZ works amazingly well, and there is absolutely no pixelation during game action.I'm not really into all the technical mumbo jumbo...I just wanted a set and home theater system that I can turn on and go with, which is what I got.  I have paired the TV with a Yamaha RX-V663 Surround Sound Receiver, the latest and greatest Sony Blu-Ray DVD player, a Definitive Technology C/L/R 2300 Center Channel Speaker (which has a built in 8" subwoofer), a Definitive Technology ProSub 1000 subwoofer, and my vintage (1980) Klipsch Heresy speakers (some of the absolute best speakers ever made).  Combined with the awesome picture of the TV is a mind blowing sound that you would expect from a $50,000.00 setup.One recommendation would be to invest in a universal remote control.  The company that did my installation sold me the control and totally programmed it, so all I have to do is hit 1 button to get everything going.I highly recommend this Samsung TV, and look forward to watching the Cowboys in the Super Bowl in February!

Reviews.Title: Cheap DigiCam Appearance
Reviews.Author: Tom G
Reviews.Content: I've now viewed two Samsung LCD tvs including this model.  They both have the same disconcerting problem that others may call a feature.  Yes, the picture is sharp. However, objects in the foreground are excessively sharp and well defined relative to the background. It makes me feel like I'm watching the program through a cheap digicam. I don't know what you'd call this effect but I can't call it a good viewing experience.  Now, that picture 'feature' may be good for football games but not for network tv shows where it's the most pronounced. It's evident to a lesser extent on movies.  I would not buy this tv.

Reviews.Title: Confused over pricing
Reviews.Author: George R. Farrell
Reviews.Content: I have a friend that has this TV and the picture is great.I am really confused over the pricing. I did see this TV for 1330.00 right after the Super Bowl. Today's price in 1480.00 and wow it is even in my Gold Box for a whopping 1406.11. I am sorry that is not any deal at all

Reviews.Title: Is it worth the money?
Reviews.Author: Kdg75
Reviews.Content: My husband really wanted this TV and I loved the "touch of red" so we have had it for four days now. After playing on the PS3, watching a blueray movie, and watching HD TV shows, I have a few complaints. First, the remote is completely awful! My old Olevia had a really user-friendly remote, but with the Samsung, you get a pop-up menu that takes a while to scroll through even if you just want to adjust the brightness. It covers the entire screen so you have to pause your show while you make the smallest adjustments, and if you are a color freak like me you are constantly tweaking the colors for each show and getting terribly annoyed at the poor layout design of the Samsung.Secondly, the audio is not in sync with our surround sound so we either hear a very disturbing echo or else we have to turn the TV sound completely off. This also was not a problem with our prior TV.Thirdly, I have noticed quite a lot of banding on dark scenes and also some blockiness/pixelation on scenes with a lot of motion. This is the problem that has me wondering if we should return this TV ASAP! I certainly would not expect such poor quality from such an expensive TV!

Reviews.Title: 5 stars for everything except 1
Reviews.Author: Kram
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a month now. And the picture quality is just stunning.  The TV excels in every area and that has been covered by everyone here.I will just highlight one aspect that took away from a 5 star review - the TV does not have unique a on/off switch. Using a Harmony 880 universal remote, this means that shifting from each input ends up switching off the TV.

Reviews.Title: On the verge of buying this from Amazon--one major concern/question
Reviews.Author: Michael Gough
Reviews.Content: I know this isn't exactly a proper review, but I didn't know how else to approach it. I have been astounded by the picture on theLN46A650 every time I've seen it in stores. All the raves are true. I have one major concern--perhaps someone can give me their experience/feedback? I have several significant sources of light in the viewing area (including a big window behind where you sit--unavoidable) and I'm worried about the Samsung's new glossy/reflective screen. I know it makes the picture look that much better, but I always figured i'd be safe with a matte screen (ala Sony). Is the reflection going to compromise the picture too much? It's the only reason Iwould hesitate to get it. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Samsung (touch of red) Review
Reviews.Author: Polly N. Mayberry
Reviews.Content: We've been very pleased with this TV except for the white flashing line across the top of the screen.  We've tried resizing the picture, nothing works.

Reviews.Title: Touch of Color bezel ruins otherwise good TV
Reviews.Author: M. Storms
Reviews.Content: The Touch of Color plastic bezel is made of such soft plastic that it is impossible not to scratch. No matter how carefully you try to protect the plastic, any attempt to dust or clean the bezel results in fine scratches and eventually a white haze. What's worse, any lights in the room catch the hazy scratches and cause horrible, glaring reflections. I called Samsung technical support twice about this problem, and all they said was "we don't warrant against physical damage."It's a shame, because the quality of the picture is very good. But you can't watch the picture because your view is constantly distracted by the glare from the bezel.My advice is to spend your money on an LCD with a more traditional metal or solid black frame.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Amazing buying experience at Amazon
Reviews.Author: S. Arora "DesiDude"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the TV. I came home and it was already step up in the living room.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Caliboy
Reviews.Content: I had bought this TV a month back and I am very happy with the price at amazon and the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Can I play music from my iPod while watching a movie?
Reviews.Author: BMW
Reviews.Content: I thought the 750 would let me do this. What am I doing wrong.Hate the remote. Never owned a "universal" remote --does such a thing allow me to more easily access all the features of the 750--obviously I'm challenged by accessing the bells and whistles, but love them!

Reviews.Title: Great used samsung 46a650
Reviews.Author: Bang Phan "Samsung2008"
Reviews.Content: I have received this TV as scheduled and the product works as advertised. This is the current Samsung best technology for this year.

Reviews.Title: Cheated by amazon.com
Reviews.Author: Muazzam Saeed
Reviews.Content: 1. Two weeks after I purchase this TV, the price dropped $235. when I contacted customer service for price protection policy, they refused.2. Later I found that this TV has an issue where the picture disappears automatically and comes back. Amazon and Samsung were recommending a patch. I decided to return the TV. It took me about 6 weeks and many emails to get the amazon pick up my TV for return. Now for the refund they charged 20% re-stocking fee. This fee is not mentioned any where.Simply, Amazon has proved themselves to be a cheater. It is very hard to communicate with them, you cannot reply to any of their emails.

Reviews.Title: Amazon and Samsung service is terrible.
Reviews.Author: J. Cunningham
Reviews.Content: On June 12, I ordered the Samsung LN46A650 from Amazon.  Amazon farmed the order out to Adorama and I received the TV on June 20 with no shipping crate damage; HOWEVER, the product was an out-of-crate failure.  About 1/3 of the screen was black in a irregular pattern. On June 21, Samsung wsa called, and on Monday, June 23 Adorama and Amazon were called and a replacement was requested.  Nothing happened until July 2, when a Samsung contracted repair shop picked up the TV.  As of July 13, I still have no TV and no one has offered to replace the defective set.Interestingly, the Samsung work order gave a purchase date of 5/31, which leads me to believe that I was knowingly shipped a defective set that a previous customer had purchased on 5/31 and returned to Adorama.  I can not recommend this TV because of the extremely poor service from Samsung, Amazon, and Adorama.

Reviews.Title: Appalling Warranty Service from Samsung
Reviews.Author: Ernest Daniels "Roboticist and Historian"
Reviews.Content: My Samsung LCD monitor flickered and went black, this was about 2.5 years into a 3-year Samsung warranty.  Then I entered Samsung Warranty Hell, a process that I want to make everyone aware of before they buy products from Samsung.Stage 1: Getting your ticket online.  You fill out all of your information on their support web page and get a ticket number.  In my case I opted for an "advance exchange" -- Samsung put a hold on my credit card so that I could immediately obtain a replacement monitor, in advance of returning my failed unit.  Great!Stage 2: After nothing happens for a few days, you call their customer service line.  They tell you to keep waiting.Stage 3: After a few more frustrating calls to customer service, I asked for a supervisor who eventually referred me to Samsung's "Executive Customer Relations Group".  I was very quickly on the phone with a representative.  Great!Stage 4: This is when you learn from the ECR group that even though Samsung has placed a hold on your credit card, they cannot issue you a replacement monitor for 2-3 weeks.  Weeks???  I told them that was unacceptable, and after a couple more calls to the ECR group I was offered a refund instead.  I was told that the refund will take 2-3 weeks to arrive.  Great!  They sent me a UPS slip and I sent my broken monitor in.Stage 5: After waiting 3 weeks I called the ECR group back and was told that for some reason my refund was not processed.  They will email the refund department and call me back.  I have been promised a call back several times now, but never gotten one.Stage 6: Anger.  As things now stand, Samsung's ECR group keeps promising to call me back, that my problem has been escalated, etc.  They keep telling me that the "refund department", who they can only reach by email, is not answering their emails.I've dealt with Samsung firmly but politely throughout, and all I have gotten so far is a runaround.  They took my broken monitor but as of this writing I am still waiting for a refund, more than a month after they received my failed unit.  I really liked my monitor before it broke, but after this experience I will steer clear of all Samsung products and advise the reader to do the same.  This is the worst customer support experience I have ever had with any company.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever...surprise it is even better than Sony
Reviews.Author: T. Poland
Reviews.Content: you will love the Samsung LN46A650 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with RED Touch of Color the picher is the best I give it a 5***** star. Amazon has the best price on the web. man free shipping and no tax on it wow. you can see my pic. I took on the remote and the movie 300

Reviews.Title: Great TV -- Too Much Junk
Reviews.Author: Don Davies
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic 46" LCD.  The picture quality is absolutely outstanding for the price.  I use it in a dark room, so glare is a non-issue.My wife and I both think that the red bezel looks terrific.  Its pretty subtle in a dark room.My only issue with this set is its plethora of "features" that I don't need.  I wish Samsung would offer a stripped down, monitor only version of this 120Hz set that is slightly less expensive.  For most people who will use this TV with cable or dish, the tuner is unnecessary.  When you use a modern AV receiver, you really only need a single HDMI input on the TV.  And, of course, you will never use the decent built-in speakers if you use external speakers in your home theater.  Add a universal remote, and the Samsung remote (which isn't great anyway) is worthless.  Connect a computer or gaming console and you no longer need Samsung's InfoLink to display Internet content or its ability to display photos from a memory card.  And, Samsung's limited picture-in-picture feature is pretty much useless.Overall, this is a great TV based on picture quality alone.  If you are in need of the internal speakers or other included features, its an even better deal.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, One Major Flaw
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV, but it is not without a few flaws.Pros: Brilliant picture with better black than I anticipated.  Motion blurring is no longer an issue with these 120hz sets, which is great for sports fans or gamers.  There are also plenty of connections for additional devices.  It is a great TV...the best I have ever owned.Cons: They have a great remote, but it is not universal (COME ON!) and thus will not control your cable/satellite box.  I called Samsung to confirm this and they said they had issues with the previous model (too many consumer complaints) and removed the universal capabilities.  ***By the way Samsung...you can also receive complaints for a LACK of basic features and this is one of them.  The issues should have been resolved.  Anyway, this will not be an issue for many who have more complex set ups and need a universal remote anyway.The Anynet feature is a nice concept allowing you to more easily control numerous Samsung devices, like a BluRay DVD, simply; however, it falls short on keeping it simple since you have to have to use two remotes or buy a separate universal remote...all which add complexity.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Sravan Pillarisetty "sravan"
Reviews.Content: i like the TV it has good picture and did not find any issues with till now (1 month), about the shipping service i read lot of issues and was worried but i received my tv in just 2 days,i guess i was lucky or they really improved their services.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Steven Mckee
Reviews.Content: The only con (so far) with this TV is the price.  However, you are getting one of the best LCDs available, so the money is well spent.  Amazon's white glove service was also a nice addition to the free shipping.  More to come after a further review is available.

Reviews.Title: Product: Great!! , -  Amazon "Executive Customer Relations": Craptastic
Reviews.Author: J. Lu
Reviews.Content: This is one amazing television. Combined with my Verizon HD FiOS tv service, the picture quality I get is stunning. Friends and family, who also have hd tvs always comment on the great picture whenever they come over.Amazon "Executive Customer Relations":I actually had to order a replacement because my first tv was delivered damaged. There was some (cosmetic, i think) damage to the corner of the bezel. I called Amazon and explained the damage and the csr said a replacement would be ordered and sent out. Return of the damaged tv would need to be set up with the delivery company. Coordinating with the original delivery company for the return, a different shipping company for delivery of the replacement and Amazon actually was a really big mess for about two weeks.I was told by the csr that the new tv would be sent out right away and there would be a 30 day window to return the original. I scheduled the return and delivery of replacement for the same day. In the morning, the damaged set was picked up by the original delivery company. The replacement was scheduled for delivery later that day.Then I receive a call from the new shipping company saying they've been told by Amazon not to deliver the new tv. WHAT?! So I call Amazon and the csr could not help. 10 minutes later, around 1:30pm, i get en email from Amazon's "Executive Customer Relations" saying that the tv I returned was not the original 46" I had ordered, but some other 40" tv. And that they would not release the replacement tv until the original 46" tv was returned to Amazon and confirmed.I knew this was impossible since the shipping guys had just picked up the damaged set that morning and there's no way Amazon could even know what was returned. I called the shipping company, the manager said that truck had JUST arrived st the warehouse and they haven't yet unloaded anything from the truck. So, I don't know how Amazon could have received any return item from me at all. Besides, what happened to the 30-day window for return?Anyway, this was a royal mess having to deal with this "Executive Customer Relations" dept. There's no number to contact them, just an email. I must have sent them 20 emails in the first 3 days since the issue and not one of them was responded to. In the end I finally received the replacement tv, but I was without any tv for about 2 weeks. What a pain!!

Reviews.Title: early review
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Reichlen "bobr"
Reviews.Content: I haven't got any HD input yet, but the picture quality is much better than on previous TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung product good Amazon service Bad
Reviews.Author: AmazonCustomer
Reviews.Content: 1. The rating is based on Amazon's service not on the quality of the product which is very good.2. DO NOT believe Amazon's "white glove delivery" advertisment. If you think that you may save money buying from Amazon with the white glove delivery included FALSE advertisment you will be horribly surprised. Go somewhere else where they really offer white glove delivery.My situation: I ordered Samsung's 46in HDTV precisely because of their  white glove delivery service promise. BAD mistake. First of all, only one person (not 2 as in a real "white glove delivery") showed up with a small cart on which he put the box with the TV. He stopped at my door. That is all! I had to help him move the box inside. He did not want to even open the box saying he is not payd for that.Bottomline: DO NOT BUY FROM AMAZON IF YOU WANT WHITE GLOVE DELIVERY!

Reviews.Title: Broken TV
Reviews.Author: Buck Naked
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Samsung LN46A650 46-inch tv, which is actually a very nice TV.  The problem was, it showed up to my house BROKEN!  I had to refuse the shipment and now I still have my old TV. What a pain in the a$$ this whole process was.  Not to mention the fact it took about 10 days for the TV to get from Indiana to the Washington area.  But then again, you can't really complain about no taxes, no shipping cost.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality and Customer Service
Reviews.Author: J. Abramson "lajoe"
Reviews.Content: 20 Month old TV picture died (still has sound). No service in San Diego, and no response from authorized repair center after 3 calls. Bad circuit board which seems common if you Google search Samsung TV problems. Samsung service told me I was out of luck. Parts/labor to repair was quoted at over $500 when I finally got a Sears repair man to come out. For a premium quality product like Samsung, they take no pride in quality and have poor customer service. BUY AT YOUR OWN PERIL....."

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Plasma lot better than Samsung LCD
Reviews.Author: D. Truong
Reviews.Content: Before I started my comments on this product, I must say that Amazon gives excellent service delivery for this product. However for this TV, I have to rate it 3 stars.I read lot of people's reviews this item and thought it's good TV until I bought it. I completely disappointed with the color setting of this LCD. The color looked too yellow and red. I could not make it any better. Compared it to my 720P Panasonic Plasma, the plasma color is beautiful out of the box. The sound is another terrible thing on this TV, with surround sound on, I cannot understand clearly because it sounded like you bring the sound recorder to theater and recorded. Overall, it looks good with PC input. However, with others, DVD and TV inputs, the color on this TV is not good. One other thing is missing is the caption will not work if you're using component video cable as the catalog stated. If you don't believe me. Buy this TV and find out.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE! BEWARE!
Reviews.Author: Morgan Fletchall
Reviews.Content: BUYERS BEWARE BECAUSE THIS PRODUCT CAN TAKE UP TO TWO WEEKS TO ARRIVE. ALSO TAKE NOTICE THAT IF BOUGHT FROM AMAZON THEY CHARGE TAX FOR CERTAIN STATES! I ENDED UP PAYING OVER $100 MORE AND TRIED TO CANCEL BUT THEY WOULDN'T LET ME!

Reviews.Title: ok which model should i get?
Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: ok folks...which Samsung should i get...this new 46" 650 series or the 46"Samsung LN-T4681F LED from last year?i saw both for the same price...and i'm torn...does the LED in the 81 trump the 4ms in the 650 or the other way around?which one has les potential for 'blur' or 'triple ball' or are these issues eliminated in both of these models...is the LED really more reliable or is the technology still too new to determine?arrggh decisions decisions...any advice would be appreciated!

Reviews.Title: Dunno 'bout the TV 'cause Comcast sucks
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Podd
Reviews.Content: Took a longish time to get the thing delivered, but when it arrived, it was in excellent condition and looked handsome in my cabinet.  Unfortunately, because Comcast is incompetent, really incompetent, it has been a full 26 days so far and I still have yet to actually see a HDTV picture on my HDTV set.  But, ask me again about this TV when Comcast actually successfully gets the HD signal into my house, and I can see an HD picture on it.  Keep in mind it is close to 45 days since I placed the order for this TV with Amazon, and 26 days since I signed up for HDTV from Comcast and for which I am paying but receiving nothing.

Reviews.Title: If you want your films to look like video - this is the TV for you.
Reviews.Author: Taylor Garvin
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say that I've owned this TV for a whole five hours, and that I don't have HD yet, so I'm running it through Coax.  That said this LCD is a disappointment as a SD TV.  The ghosting is horrific.  The 120hz is almost completely useless.  But I figure some of these issues will be fixed when I go HD.  Now my biggest problem with this TV is that it makes movies shot on film look like movies shot on video.  I currently feel like I just wasted $1500 for a LCD TV that has a worse picture than my $250 CRT TV.I'll make sure to update you all on the picture quality when I get HD.

Reviews.Title: BEST TV EVER - WORST as A COMPUTER MONITOR
Reviews.Author: Jedi Master "edion2"
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN46A650 46-inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV with RED Touch of ColorIts been 2 weeks since I recieved this TV.  This Samsung LN46A650 replaced my 42" Westinghouse monitor which I took to my office. For its MAIN intended use as a TV . . .  its superb.  HDTV broadcast over cable is beautiful and Blue Ray play back is just STUNNING !  Compared to my Westinghouse, the black level performance is breathtakingly better.  I've only had this unit for 2 weeks so I have not explored everything to the n-th degree.  I use this TV for my work almost 50% of the time.  This TV is used as a computer monitor for CAD drafting (AutoCad).IF . . . your use is 95% as a TV for movies and cable/satellite broadcast, you can't ask for a better TV.  4-1/2 STAR RATiNG AS A TV !CONS (USING AS A TV) :--> ONLY 3 CUSTOM SETTING -  If you are picky about PICTURE SETTINGS for different INPUTS, this TV DOES NOT allow a specific setting for each input.  I am used to being able to have specific setting for Cable, DVD/Blue Ray, Game and PC inputs.  There are 3 PICTURE MODES, "Dynamic", "Standard" and "Movie".  You do your specific tweaking for each mode THEN apply the "Mode" of choice to each input.  So far I have my Blue Ray connected to "HDMI 1" and my HD cable to "Component" and I was able to tweak to my heart's desire for both inputs.  BUT . . .  (continued below in "used as computer monitor")--> PIP IS ONLY FOR THE STANDARD DEFINITION "ANTENNA/CABLE" INPUT :  Only the analog input can be over-layed on the main picture.  YOU CAN NOT DISPLAY ANY COMPONENT, HDMI OR PC INPUT AS PIP SOURCE . . .  AND  YOU CAN NOT SWAP  PIP AND MAIN SCREEN.  I spent how much? . . . and I can't have an HD PIP while working on my computer ??  DISAPPOINTED !!--> NO PIP BUTTON ON THE REMOTE :  The only way to turn on the PIP is to go through the MAIN MENU . . .  very cumbersome.--> WORST DESIGNED REMOTE I'VE EVER USED - I hate it and so does everyone else.-----------------------CONS  (USING TV AS A COMPUTER MONITOR) : MY REASON for a 1 STAR RATING OVERALL-->> NOT ALL ADJUSTABLE SETTINGS WORK WITH ALL "MODES" OR "INPUTS" -  I connected my laptop (DVI output via DVI-to-HDMI cable) to the HDMI 2.  I have my video card to output at 1920x1080, the same setting I used for my Westinghouse.  FIRST IMPRESSION IS "WOW ITS FUZZY" AND IT DOES NOT FILL THE SCREEN.  THERE IS A BLACK BAND OF BOUT AN INCH ALL AROUND THE FULL SIZE WINDOW !!  Ok, it needs to be tweaked.  So I selected "Standard" mode BUT much to my surprise some settings were "greyed out" and not accessible.  I can't change the "sharpness" setting for use as a computer monitor through either  the HDMI 2 or the PC input using the VGA cable!!  ITS STUCK AT 50 IN THE RANGE OF 0 to 100 AND CAN'T BE ADJUSTED !!!  I NEED TO SET IT TO 100.-->> SINGLE LINE COLOR FOR CAD SOFTWARE IS IMPROPERLY DISPLAYED -  AutoCad using 256 color palette displayed on a black backgroud displays wrong color vertically and diagonally.  The correct color is displayed only when its perfectly horizontal.  The way my AutoCad is set up, plotted line width is dependant on the color.  EACH OF MY MAIN COLOR HAS 3 DIFFERENT SHADES DENOTING 3 DIFFERENT LINE WITDH OR SCREENING WHEN PLOTTED.  THESE SHADES ARE NOT DISTINGUISHABLE. This may be a problem of vertical and horizontal sync frequency BUT THERE ARE NO ADJUSTMENTS AVAILABLE to correct the problem.  I've tried everything on the video card but can't get rid of this problem.  I'm going to contact Samsung for a specific driver for the 650 series LCD (IF THEY HAVE ONE) to see if that would fix it.  The TV is recieving 1920x1080 but does not fill the screen.  It measures about 43" viewable area.-->> FONTS IN INTERNET PAGES AND WORD PROCESSOR IS FUZZY :  I thought it was just a problem with AutoCad but ALL software windows displayed as "graphics" is fuzzy.  The only thing that looks DECENT are photos and 3D renderings.CONCLUSION :This TV IS SUPERB, as a TV . . .  no questions about that.  But . . .  IT FAILS MISERABLY AS A COMPUTER MONITOR.  My inferior Westinghouse runs circles around this Samsung when used as a COMPUTER MONITOR.  It might be the combination of my video card and this TV, but I doubt it.  If you intend to use this TV as a computer monitor more than ocaisionally, YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED.With my old Westinghouse,  I just plugged in the DVI out from my computer and it displayed the image full screen with accurate color.  A little tweak on "brightness", "contrast", "backlight" and "hue" and it looked just as sharp as my LCD monitor on my laptop. . . NO MATTER WHAT SOFTWARE I RAN.I had expected THIS SAMSUNG TV to be at least equal to the Westinghouse as a computer monitor.  I WAS WRONG AND DISAPPOINTED.  Take your laptop to a local store and try it out  FIRST. . .  then buy from Amazon at a better price.  AS A COMPUTER MONITOR FOR ANYTHING OTHER THAN E-MAIL AND WORD PROCESSING, THIS UNIT IS NEARLY UNUSABLE.
